title: '0' Decal
summary:
Decals are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

This decal represents the number 0.
game_description: Placeable decorative decals.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a base-building component.
* Frontiers - renamed, formerly "Decal".

title: 'Keen Poster
summary:
Posters are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

The poster pictured here uses the standard Alphabet to display the phrase "Keen as a bean for Vykeen".
game_description: Self-adhesive, crease-proof wall art.
source_info: Blueprint can be purchased from the Construction Research Station for 1 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component.

title: Ablative Armour
summary: Ablative Armour is a shield technology for the starship which improves shield durability.
game_description:
Adds a layer of superheated shielding to the starship's defense array, vaporising incoming fire.

Significantly increases starship shield performance.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Hyperion in Space Anomaly.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, previously used Cobalt Mirror and Sodium Nitrate.
additional_info:
*Upgrade bonuses trigger if Ablative Armour is adjacent to Deflector Shield or Deflector Shield Upgrades, increasing its bonus above the listed value.
**Ablative Armour does not count toward the three-upgrade limit; however, only one Ablative Armour technology can be installed at a time.

title: Acceleration Module
summary:
Acceleration Module technology is technology that upgrades a player's exocraft. 

The three upgrades for the basic Acceleration Module have been obsolete since NEXT.

title: Acid
summary: Acid is a advanced agricultural products.
game_description:
Dilute acid for high current generation in diverse power cells. 

Crafted from Mordite and Fungal Mould.
source_info: *Blueprint can be awarded by completing a certain stage of Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Pathfinder - Added as a trade commodity.
* Atlas Rises - Blueprint changed, formerly used Temerium.
* NEXT - Value changed, formerly it was worth 288,000.0
additional_info: *Acid is tied with Dirt and Iron for the shortest item name in the current version of No Man’s Sky, with 4 characters.

title: Advanced Exocraft Laser
summary: Advanced Exocraft Laser is the sole technology upgrade available for the Exocraft Mining Laser. The upgrade increases the weapon's mining power and grants it the ability to harvest tough minerals.
game_description: Increases power of the Exocraft Mining Laser.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - Bonuses changed, formerly "+55% Damage" (no effect).
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly Exocraft Mining Laser Upgrade Sigma

infobox.stats: +20% Mining Laser Power, +100% Advanced Exocraft Mining Laser

title: Advanced Translator
summary: Advanced Translator technology allows a player to understand alien words faster. The additional words are not permanently learned, only understood.
game_description:
An Automatic translation device. It records and parses nearby conversations before running the data through a contextual learning system to determine intended meaning.

A large memory array and overclocked language processors allow the real-time translation of significant chunks of speech.
source_info:
The blueprint can be acquired from Technology Merchants selling Exosuit technologies.
The blueprint can also be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
The "Words Translated" stats operate as follows: 

* 1.0-7.0 words total: When all four technologies are installed, you will always get a minimum of one word translated for you up to the highest amount attained, even if the translated word is already learned.

There are several variations of this technology:

* Tier C - Artemis' Translator
* Tier B - Simple Translator
* Tier A - Superior Translator
* Tier S - Advanced Translator

title: Aeration Membrane
summary:
The Aeration Membrane system is a Stamina technology upgrade for the Exosuit.

Aeration Membranes increase a user's ability to swim underwater longer, and can be used alongside other Aeration Membrane upgrades.
game_description:
User is able to swim underwater for extended periods.

Absorbs gases dissolved in water through a membrane contractor that, if user is of a conventionally structured species, is placed over the mouth or facial breathing hole.

Operates automatically once constructed within user's exosuit inventory.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
release_history: * Beyond - Reintroduced into game as its own tech.
additional_info: * Aeration Membrane does not provide any adjacency bonuses to the Underwater Protection Modules, nor can any of the other hazard protection upgrades do the same. It does, however, share an adjacency bonus with the other hazard protection upgrades.

title: Agricultural Specialist's Room
summary: '''Agricultural Specialist's Room''' is a Freighter Base Building module accomodating Farmer terminal.
game_description:
Integrated freighter research equipment tailored to the needs of farmers, and equipped for the analysis and cultivation of farmable crops.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Air Filtration Unit
summary: Air Filtration Unit is a hazard protection upgrade for the Exocraft.
game_description:
Double-vacuumed air filtration systems allow no trace of the planetary atmosphere into the Exocraft cabin without being thoroughly scrubbed.

Entirely prevents all damage or energy drain while inside an Exocraft in toxic environments.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology

title: Airburst Engine
summary:
Airburst Engine is a technology that allows a player to recharge exosuit jetpack while airborne.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description:
A powerful upgrade for the Exosuit Jetpack, allowing limited jetpack recharging while airborne.

Highly efficient compressors fitted around the jetpack exhaust take advantage of the windflow generated by persistent falling, recycling some of that energy into jetpack fuel.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly for 460
release_history: * Synthesis - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
*Upgrade bonuses trigger if Airburst Engine are adjacent to Neural Stimulator or Movement System Upgrades, but the technology is not actually affected by these bonuses.
**Airburst Engine does not count toward the three-upgrade limit; however, only one Airburst Engine technology can be installed at a time.

title: Alloy Arch
summary:
Alloy Arch is a Base building structure used to erect basic structures.

The basic component's preview auto-snaps to the edges of other basic components.
game_description:
Reinforced Alloy building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibilty with other prefab structurs. Rapid Grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts
release_history: * Frontiers - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: *The blueprint is learned from a Construction Research Unit, or Construction Research Station.

title: Alternative Landing Pad
summary:
thumb|Alternative Landing Pad on the ground
Alternative Landing Pad is a base building product that provides a platform where starships can land and take off. This includes not only the player's ship, but also NPC traders. 

* Players may call their ship to a alternative landing pad using Navigation Data.
* Taking off from a landing pad has no Launch Thruster cost.
* When constructing an alternative Landing Pad, they cannot be attached to buildings directly and can only be place on top of the planet surface or floor parts such as Concrete Floor Panel, Wood Floor Panel and Metal Floor Panel.
* Starships will be placed upon available landing pads when teleporting back to the player’s base.
* NPC starships may land on landing pads.
game_description: A stable, reinforced landing pad for starships.
release_history:
* Waypoint - Recipe changed, previously used 25 carbon.
* Frontiers - Introduced to the game.
additional_info:
* The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Station for 1 Salvaged Data.
* Landing craft will be oriented with the instrument boxes and the angled corner to their right.
*

title: Amino Chamber
summary: Amino Chamber is a component that is used for crafting.
game_description:
A specialist biological catalyzation device.

This unit takes advantage of naturally occurring enzymes in order to facilitate increased energy yields and faster processing in a wide range of advanced technologies.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Origins - Added as a product.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Amplified Cartridges
summary:
Amplified Cartridges is a Multi-tool upgrade which significantly increases the number of rounds which can be held by the Pulse Spitter. It is acquired as a blueprint, which blueprint can be purchased from Iteration: Eos.

Amplified Cartridges needs to be crafted and then stored in a Multi-tool inventory slot for it to have its effect. Unlike Pulse Spitter Upgrades, this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for enhancing Upgrade bonuses on other upgrades.
game_description: Specialist harmonic resonators allow the Pulse Spitter to split inserted ammunition, effective
release_history:
*NEXT - Added to the game.
*Beyond - Source changed, previously could be acquired from a vendor.
*Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used TetraCobalt.

title: Amplified Warp Shielding
summary: Amplified Warp Shielding is a freighter technology that allows warping to red Star systems.
game_description:
Upgrades the hyperdrive's core bounding magnets, preventing rapid disassembly when attempting to reach rare-class red stellar bodies.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems via the Galactic Map.
source_info: The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for four Salvaged Frigate Modules.
release_history:
* Synthesis - Added as a technology that can be researched at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Superoxide Crystal.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* When placed adjacent to Freighter Hyperdrive or other freighter technologies, the player will receive additional bonuses.

title: Anomaly Decal
summary: Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description:
An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.

This decal depicts Traveller Anomaly.
release_history: * NEXT 1.58 - added as a base-building component.

title: Antimatter
summary:
Antimatter is a component and the last ingredient needed to craft a Warp Cell.  

Once you have built your first Hyperdrive, the mission will take you to an abandoned building. The terminal there will give you the antimatter blueprint.
game_description:
Contained negative matter and baryogenesis antiparticles.

The vast energy potential of antimatter makes it highly valuable. 95% of existing antimatter consumption is in the powering of starship hyperdrives.

WARNING: uncontained usage is not recommended.
source_info:
* Can be automatically harvested by Cargo Drops or Barrel Fabricators.
* Can sometimes be bought at Galactic Trade Terminals or from NPCs.
*
release_history:
* Release - Added as a product.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Electron Vapour, Heridium and Zinc.

title: Antimatter Housing
summary: Antimatter Housing is a component needed to craft a Warp Cell.
game_description:
Secure antimatter containment device, required before Antimatter can be safely secured as Warp Cells.

Rebound Oxygen forms a protective gas pocket, preventing the antimatter from reacting with the surrounding casing.
source_info:
Antimatter Housing can be purchased at Technology Merchants.

This item has a 10% chance to drop out of barrel-type cargo.   The AtlasPass v1 access card is required to open these.
use_info: Crafting
release_history: * NEXT - Added as a product.

title: Apollo Decal
summary: Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description:
An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.

This decal depicts the Traveller Apollo.
release_history: * NEXT 1.58 - added as a base-building component.

title: Appearance Modifier Room
summary: Appearance Modifier Room is a Freighter Base Building module replacing Appearance Modifier.
game_description:
Integrated freighter equipment allowing the user to adjust their personal appearance settings. This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.

The module applies advanced holographic techniques to recalibrate the light around the user, allowing them to adopt whatever appearance they desire. Visual data must be properly formatted before use.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Archive Bypass Implant
summary: Archive Bypass Implant is a Planetary Archive.
game_description: A biotechnical firewall, developed as a safeguard against textual cognitohazards.  It is coated in something slippery, and has started to bubble along the surface.
source_info:
* Blueprint is received as a reward from Hunt 3, Milestone 4 They Pushed too Far as part of Expedition 4: Emergence.
* Must be constructed using the blueprint.
release_history:
* Frontiers - This item was added to the game as part of the Expedition 4.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Archive Override Implant".

title: Ariadne's Flame
summary:
'''Ariadne's Flame ''' is a propulsion upgrade for the Exocraft.

Blueprint can be purchases for 180 nanites.
game_description:
A series of agile, high-powered jet thrusters mounted to the rear of the rear of the Minotaur. Precise use allows the Minotaur to quickly and powerfully traverse all manner of terrain.

Press and hold JUMP/IMG to activate. Limited in-flight control is possible.
release_history:
*ExoMech - Added to game
*Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Superoxide Crystal

title: Aronium
summary: Aronium is a tradeable.
game_description:
A lightweight and highly malleable alloy. Crafted from Paraffinium and Ionised Cobalt.

In high demand on the Galactic Trade Network due to its utility in the construction of planetside outposts and facilities.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history: * Interceptor - Corrected description to list the correct crafting ingredients.

title: Artemis Decal
summary: Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description:
An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.

This decal depicts the Traveller Artemis.
release_history: * NEXT 1.58 - added as a base-building component.

title: Artemis' Translator
summary: '''Artemis' Translator''' technology allows a player to understand alien words more quickly.
game_description:
An automatic translation device. Device must be calibrated by pre-loading with existing translation data. Device must have network connection to Artemis to function.

Without access to host translation service, on-board circuit allows limited real-time translation of a small number of words.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired during the Artemis path.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
The "Words Translated" stat operates as follows:

* 1.0-7.0 words total: When all four technologies are installed, you will always get a minimum of one word translated for you up to the highest amount attained, even if the translated words are already learned.

There are several variations of this technology:

* Tier C - Artemis' Translator
* Tier B - Simple Translator
* Tier A - Superior Translator
* Tier S - Advanced Translator

summary:
Asymmetrical Timber-Glass Roof is a Base building structure used to erect basic structures.

The basic component's preview auto-snaps to the edges of other basic components.
game_description:
Reinforced Timber building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

title: Atlantid Drive
summary: Atlantid Drive is a Worlds Part II and is a further upgrade to the purple coloured Indium, Emeril or Cadmium Drive installed.
game_description:
Sideloads a resonant memory packet into your warp computer, allowing the ship to pass through the dissonant space surrounding purple stellar bodies.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems via the Galactic Map.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired during the In Stellar Multitudes questline.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* Gives a bonus to hyperdrive range if the upgrade module is installed adjacent to the ship's hyperdrive or other drive modules.
* In order to unlock the In Stellar Multitudes quest, both They Who Returned and The Atlas Path must first be completed.

title: Atmospheric Control Unit

A critical freighter subsystem, vital for maintaining a habitable and safe environment for all on-board organic lifeforms.

Capable of generated
release_history: *Endurance - Added as a technology.

title: Auto Switch
summary: Auto Switch is a base building product that is used to toggle power to buildings using Electrical Wiring.
game_description:
A power management device, this switch will toggle the flow of power when signaled by an incoming signal.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.
additional_info:
* The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for Salvaged Data.
* The product has a 3rd socket/control socket that is located in the middle of the product (or at the bottom if the product is placed vertically on a wall). The socket needs to be powered together with an input socket for this product to supply power to the output socket.

title: Automatic translation device
summary:
Automatic translation device technology allows a player to understand alien words more quickly, even though you haven't learned them yet.

It records and parses nearby conversations before running the data through a contextual learning system to determine intended meaning.

During a conversation, you will see more words of the conversation than you have actually learned. Even if you have only learned a couple of words, more of the sentence will be understandable. However, the translator doesn't teach you these additional words - they are only understood for the duration of the conversation (or if the same line is repeated by that character within a short time by talking to them again).
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Technology Merchants selling Exosuit technologies.
release_history: *Beyond - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
There are several variations of this technology:
*Tier C - Artemis' Translator - Translates 1 word
*Tier B - Simple Translator - Translates 1 word
*Tier A - Superior Translator - Translates 2 words
*Tier S - Advanced Translator - Translates 3 words

Having more than one will allow more words to be translated, up to a total of 7 words. Once you have learned all in-game words the normal way, there are still words that need translating, that you can never learn. These translators take care of that problem.

Even though a synergy bonus is normally provided by connections in other technology, translations do not provide synergy. Having all 4 will provide you with 7 words translated, but they will not provide you with more by placing them together.

title: Autonomous Positioning Unit
summary: Autonomous Positioning Unit is a 4th tier tradeable.
game_description:
A container of positioning units and associated wiring.

These APS units can be used to turn virtually any technology into a self-navigating system. Highly valuable in power generation economies, where they're used to remove conductive organic hands from the manufacturing process.
source_info: Autonomous Positioning Unit can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Technology Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, medium-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Autonomous Positioning Unit can be sold for a profit in any Power Generation Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Technology Parts".

title: Barrel Ioniser
summary: Barrel Ioniser is a technology that augments the Boltcaster, a Multi-tool weapon. Its effects stack with those provided by Boltcaster Upgrades, but this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for triggering stronger upgrade bonuses on those upgrades.
game_description:
Inserts a powerful field ionisation device into the barrel of the Boltcaster, increasing projectile stability through the air.

Improves device accuracy and allows the user to fire for longer periods without degrading combat performance.
release_history: * NEXT - Added as a technology.

title: Base Teleport Module
summary:
Base Teleport Module is a base building product, which allows the player to quickly teleport between any bases and space stations they have visited previously.

A
game_description:
A personal teleport device, allowing the user to move quickly between their constructed bases, as well as any Space Station Terminuses connected to their network.

User is urged to verify network integrity before inserting any matter they cannot afford to become separated from.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - Added as a method of transportation.
* NEXT - Added as a base building product.
* Beyond - Formula changed, previously used Ionised Cobalt and Ion Battery.
* Origins - Portal interference removed, visual interaction and assortment of destinations (bases, space stations, other player bases) now consistent with visual interface from Anomaly.
* Endurance - No longer can be built on Freighters, replaced by Teleport Chamber.
additional_info:
thumb|Teleporter ready for action
* Although referred to as the "Base Teleport Module" when constructed, the in-game interface names this structure the Teleportation Terminal when interacted with.
* You must complete an early portion of the tutorial to build and use a teleporter.
* There is no cost to teleporting (other than the time it takes to load the destination map).
* Only one teleporter per base is permitted, however this can be worked around by building additional

infobox.desc: Instant method of moving great distances

title: Battery
summary: Battery is a base building product that stores excess generated power. It can supply power to a base's electrical grid when the generators are offline.
game_description:
Highly-efficient energy storage units. Connect to a power grid, and onboard power management circuits will automatically draw down spare capacity to charge its cells.

When the grid attempts to draw more power than is currently supplied, the battery will automatically deploy power to make up the shortfall.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly, costing 3 Salvaged Data to unlock.
release_history: * Beyond 2.09.1 - Fixed an issue that caused Batteries and Solar Panels to not attach correctly to building roofs.

title: Bio-Dome
summary:
Bio-Dome is a plant up to 16 items indoors. This structure cannot be built inside Freighter bases.

The blueprint can only be obtained via Base Research Terminal inside the Anomaly.
game_description: An attractive domed room which is perfect for cultivating a wide range of botanical matter.
release_history:
* Foundation - added as a base-building component
* Atlas Rises - formula changed, formerly used Titanium, Glass, and Suspension Fluid
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Titanium, Glass, and Living Glass. The blueprint cannot be obtained from the blueprint merchant any longer.
* Beyond - Now require power to operate
additional_info:
* A corridor attached to a bio-dome will allow the full 16 slots to grow plants, even though one of them will be placed under the stairs attaching the corridor to the bio-dome. 

* Bio-Domes should mainly be used for plants that are not compatible with growing outdoors. This will save slots inside your domes for plants that are not outdoors hardy.
* Fully grown plants can be harvested all at once by interacting with the display panels that are mounted on the ceiling of the Bio-Dome.
* A Bio-Dome consumes 50kPs of power to operate. As Large Hydroponic Trays require 20kPs to provide four growing slots, therefore Bio-Domes are more efficient for growing.

title: Biofuel Reactor
summary: Biofuel Reactor is a base building product that generates power and uses organic elements as fuel. It can be connected to various base building products with Electrical Wiring to supply power to them.
game_description:
A small power generator. Burns carbon-based fuel placed in its furnace tank and converts it into usable power.

Connect power generators to base structures and technologies with electrical wiring. Many parts require power to function.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Unit.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a base building product.
* Living Ship - Blueprint changed to reduce Oxygen requirement, formerly 40.
* Endurance - Operation time on full power increased from one to 50 hours; charging resource requirements drastically reduced.
additional_info: * Full charge requires 100 Carbon, 34 Condensed Carbon, or 50 Oxygen

title: Boltcaster
summary:
The Boltcaster is an attachment for the 24px (PS4) or the 'G' key (PC).
* To reload, press the square button 24px (PS4) or the 'R' key (PC).
game_description:
Generalist weapon attachment for the Multi-Tool. Access fire mode by pressing [Triangle/G] and fire weapon with [R2/Left Mouse Button].

The Boltcaster reconfigures the Multi-Tool to supercharge Metallic Elements, firing them as high-velocity projectiles capable of causing extreme damage.
release_history:
* Release - Added as a technology.
* Pathfinder - Shortburst Adaptor and Wideshot Adaptor independent upgrades were replaced by Pulse Spitter and Scatter Blaster, respectively.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Iron and Plutonium. Barrel Ioniser and procedurally generated Boltcaster Upgrades added, while Homingbolt Adaptor and Sigma/Tau/Theta upgrades removed.
*Desolation - Base damage increased. Boltcaster now fires in bursts, added tracer lines to Boltcaster projectiles and increased projectile speed.
additional_info:
* The Boltcaster begins with a 60-round magazine and consumes 1 round per shot.
* The spread is quadratic and not circular like in most games.
* It functions like an smg.
* With the right sentinel and s/x class upgrades and arrangements, it can become an absolute killing machine.
** If the requirements above are met, it gains absurd fire rate, great damage, big clips, and very fast reload time.

title: Boltcaster (Atlas)

game_description:

Use can result in targeted entity death.
additional_info:

title: Cloaking Device
summary: The Cloaking Device is a general Multi-tool upgrade.
game_description:
On activation, this module draws power from Exosuit Life Support systems to manipulate the gravitational field around the user, refracting the light and creating an active camouflage effect.

This temporary effect can be used to escape unwanted hostile attention. WARNING: active camouflage may be aborted upon dramatic Exosuit maneuvers such as jetpack activation, or by activating Multi-Tool weapons systems.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired in the Space Anomaly for 80
release_history: *SentinelUp - added to the game
additional_info:
The following observations from using the Cloaking Device under multiple players' perspectives are as follows:
*Despite the in-game description claiming that the Cloaking Device draws life support power, this does not appear to be the case. Instead, the Cloak has its own power meter that determines the amount of time you can use it within a short interval.
*While in continual use, only a translucent blue outline is visible to you and travelers (unless you or other players are in first person mode). You will also become invisible to sentinels, but not to predators (this is a bug).
*By continuously tapping the secondary fire button, the blue outline will also completely disappear from your perspective as well as from other first-person perspectives (this is an exploit allowing you to interfere with the charge depletion rate at will). However, by using this action, sentinels and predators will follow your trail and you will appear as a flickering outline for other players currently using third person mode. In addition, all players nearby will hear a loud whooshing sound when this happens.

title: Colossus Geobay
summary:
Colossus Geobay is used to provide a safe parking lot for the Colossus Exocraft. 

Geobays can be placed anywhere, inside or outside of a claimed base. When a geobay is destroyed, the resources used to build it are returned.

All geobays have two terminals. One terminal, with a blue screen, is used to respawn the geobay's Exocraft; the other terminal, with an orange screen, grants access to Exocraft customisation.
game_description: An underground secure parking facility for the Colossus large Exocraft.
release_history: * NEXT 1.63 - Geobays can now be used to customise their respective Exocraft

title: Combat Scope
summary:
Combat Scope is a Multi-tool upgrade which adds zoom as an alt-fire function to Multi-tool weapons. It is activated by holding down the alt-fire input (Right Mouse Button on PC by default).

The Combat Scope blueprint can be purchased in the Space Anomaly for 80 Nanite Clusters. It can also be given by a Traveler at a Space Station for answering their question correctly, or by saying the word "tech" to a Korvax after attempting to practice your language skills. 

Once the blueprint has been obtained, Combat Scope can be installed in the Multi-tool inventory to gain its benefits.
game_description: A recoil-stabilising weapon scope for precise combat.
release_history: * NEXT 1.63 - Fixed an issue that prevented Blaze Javelin from firing while zoomed in with Combat Scope.

title: Communications Station
summary:
thumb|Preparing to create a message
thumb|Entering a message
thumb|Reading a comm station message
A Comm Station provides a way for a player to leave a message for other travellers to find. These messages cannot be lengthy, but they do provide a way to let other players know you exist. The are also known as "Comm Balls".
game_description: A terminal for the composition and transmission of messages to other travellers.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a base building item.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Iron.
additional_info:
After building a Communications Station, it can be programmed with a selected message. When interacting with the terminal, a message will be displayed saying "The Communications Station stands ready to accept any message left for other travellers to find."

An entry box will then be displayed, requesting that a message be entered. If the message is accepted, it will be stored in the comm station for future reference.

If you encounter a Communications Station, you will see the message "The Communications Station holds a message from a fellow traveller. It reads:", followed by the stored communication.

You may also alter the colour and material of the Communications Station by accessing the same build menu and switching to the "Delete/Colour" tab while hovering the marker over a Communications Station you have placed.

It is also important to note, that a Communications Station with an already stored message could not be deleted by the player in normal circumstances and functions as a permanent building item (like eg. the Base Computer)!

title: Conflict Scanner
summary:
Conflict Scanner is a starship technology that allows the player to check a star system's Conflict Level in the Galactic Map (shown below the system's economy status) without having to warp to that system first.

Without this technology, the player would have to warp to the system, then check the conflict level by using the Discoveries menu.
game_description: An upgrade to the starship's galactic-scale sensors. This device allows the user to access conflict data in the galaxy map, without having to put themselves in harm's way.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from a Technology Merchant for 150
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as scanner technology.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Heridium and Thamium9. Price changed, was 200 nanites.

infobox.desc: Grants the ability to check a system's Conflict Level

title: Consciousness Bridge
summary:
Consciousness Bridge is a curiosity.

It can be obtained at a Korvax Plaque as part of the Starbirth mission.
game_description:
A biomechanical construct, created to the design of an anonymous host.

This device appears to offer an interface between an individual entity and a greater shared consciousness. It appears derived from, but not attuned to, Korvax technology.
source_info: The blueprint is a reward given during the Starbirth mission.
release_history: * Living Ship - Added as a product.

title: Constructable Relic
summary:
Constructable Relic are building recipes introduced in World Parts II. They can be discovered on Reliquary planets. Use the Visor and look for a Memory Stone. Interact with it to absorb ancient knowledge: It gives you a building blueprint or Nanites.

To build one relic in your base, you need the blueprint, 25 Magnetised Ferrite, and 25 Polished Stone harvested from Ruined Structures.

*Ruined Slab
*Ruined Monument
*Ruined Wall
*Ruined Totem
*Ruined Arch
*Ruined Gateway
*Ruined Statue
*Ruined Storehouse
*Ruined Dome
*Ruined Monolith
*Large Ruined Archway
* Ruined Column

title: Construction Research Unit
summary:
Construction Research Unit is a portable Hazard Protection Unit
*Timber Shelters (Formerly Wooden Shelters)
**Includes floor panels, wall panels, roof panels, doorways and variants thereof.
*Stone Shelters (Formerly Concrete Shelters)
**Includes floor panels, wall panels, roof panels, doorways and variants thereof.
*Alloy Shelters (Formerly Metal Shelters)
**Includes floor panels, wall panels, roof panels, doorways and variants thereof.

Similar to the Construction Research Station, parts further down the tree can only be researched after all parts preceding them have been researched.
game_description:
Portable blueprint decryption device.

This field-deployable memory salvage module allows the user to convert Salvaged Data technology modules into advanced construction blueprints.
source_info: The blueprint for the Construction Research Unit can be acquired from the base building tutorial which you will access from the Base Computer after starting your first base.<ref>See [https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2019-08-16-no-mans-sky-bases-computer-construction-research-unit-base-teleport-module-6042 Eurogamer:No Man's Sky Bases: How to build a Base Computer, Construction Research Unit and Base Teleport Module]</ref>
release_history: *Beyond - Added as a constructed technology as a replacement for the Blueprint Analyser.

title: Construction Specialist's Room
summary: '''Construction Specialist's Room''' is a Freighter Base Building module accomodating Overseer terminal.
game_description:
Integrated freighter research equipment tailored to the needs of construction overseers, and equipped with architectural and engineering design software.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Construction Terminal
summary:
Terminals of various types can be crafted, each with their own special purposes. The Construction Terminal is used for base building-related items. It can be easily constructed in whole pre-fab structures; it can also be built in rooms that are made from separate wall and floor panels if the room is tall enough to fit it.

It is used by a hired NPC known as an Overseer. The Overseer can be recruited in a Space station after placing the Construction Terminal.

Blueprints for the following items can be acquired at a Construction Terminal through the Overseer's mission Expanding the Base:
game_description:
thumb|right|Construction terminal
A research station tailored to the needs of Construction Overseers, and equipped with architectural and engineering design software.
source_info: The blueprint is given upon returning to one's base after speaking with Apollo's contact during Ghosts in the Machine (the third Artemis Path mission).
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a base building product.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Iron.
*Beyond - Blueprint can no longer be acquired by building a Cylindrical Room.
**Additionally, the Construction Terminal can now be placed in the same room as another terminal.
additional_info:
* The Construction Terminal can be built in a base or within the player's freighter
* It can be built in any room which has enough space to accommodate it.
**The terminal is too tall to fit in a single-floor space of a wood/concrete/metal structure, but will fit within a two-floor space.
*The Overseer can only occupy one Construction Terminal at a time. Summoning the Overseer to a new Construction Terminal (by interacting with the empty terminal) will force them to relocate from any existing location.

title: Coolant Network
summary:
User is guarded from extreme heat damage on scorched worlds.

Provides relief from intense atmospheric and solar heat through a threaded dermal distribution network of liquid frenium.

Device is charged by mineral extracts found in hot environments. Operates automatically once constructed within user's exosuit inventory.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
release_history:
* Release - Added as a technology.
* NEXT - Removed from the game. If it was installed, it has turned into Obsolete Technology.
* Crossplay - Brought back into the game with a different description and formula
additional_info: * Works automatically when located in a player's Exosuit inventory

infobox.desc: Provides protection from heat damage on scorched worlds.

title: Cyclotron Ballista
summary: Cyclotron Ballista is a weapons technology for the starship. which fires two projectiles at a time at somewhat low velocities compared to those of other starship weapons; however, these projectiles have high base damage (only the Rocket Launcher has higher base damage per projectile).
game_description:
thumb|right|Firing the ballista on an asteroid
A powerful ship-to-ship weapon, flinging plasmatic balls of ionising radiation towards the selected target. These projectiles can disable starship engines, leaving the target vulnerable to attack from other weapons.

These charged particles are extremely effective against starship shields, and considerably weaker against the metal armour of a ship's hull.

Use () to change weapon mode. Press () to fire.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a technology.
* NEXT - Dyson Pump and procedurally generated Cyclotron Ballista Upgrades added, while Sigma/Tau/Theta upgrades removed. Blueprint changed, formerly used Nickel and Platinum.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, formerly used Technology Module instead of Wiring Loom
* Outlaws - Gained ability to disable target starship's engines
additional_info:
* If the upgrades are applied properly, this weapon becomes powerful enough to take out a freighter with one or two shots
* Cyclotron Ballista's heat status is not properly displayed in the HUD --- the bar that normally shows heat status does not fill up while firing, but the white sliver at its right end turns red when the weapon is close to overheating.
* This weapon is excellent as a secondary weapon, as it can disable engines and tear through shields.

title: Cyclotron Ballista Upgrade
summary: Cyclotron Ballista Upgrades, contained within Cyclotron Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to the starship's Cyclotron Ballista.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Synthesis - Damage bonus of S-class modules reduced from a max of 2% to 1%.
additional_info: * Upgrade bonuses trigger for Cyclotron Ballista Upgrades if they are adjacent to Cyclotron Ballista, Dyson Pump or each other, increasing their bonuses above listed values.

Category:Technology

title: Decals
summary: Decals are used in personalizing and decorating a player's home base or freighter. The blueprint provides 13 different varieties, including numbers and the No Man's Sky logo. One of the more common usages is labeling rooms and hallways for identification purposes.
game_description: Placeable decorative decals.
additional_info: *Limited to 50 of each decal per base. (eg

title: Decommissioned Circuits
summary: Decommissioned Circuits is a 1st tier tradeable.
game_description:
A collection of salvaged circuitry.

Power generation economies go through vast numbers of high-tech components. As such, the demand is present even for highly damaged circuits, to be scavenged for parts or just plugged wholesale into low-quality power cores.
source_info: Decommissioned Circuits can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all Technology Economy star systems.
use_info:
Decommissioned Circuits can be sold for a profit in any Power Generation Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5. It has the same icon as Damaged Wiring and Power Distributor.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Decommissioned Circuit Board". Type changed, formerly "Technology Parts".
additional_info: * Same icon is used by Once-Useful Springs

title: Deepwater Chamber
summary:
Deepwater Chamber is a base building product which is the underwater equivalent of Cylindrical Room.

This structure's preview auto-snaps to many horizontal and vertical anchors.
game_description: The core module for base construction, providing a generous central space on which to expand.
source_info:
* Blueprint is awarded after finding the sunken freighter during the Dreams of the Deep mission.
* The blueprint can be bought at the anomaly.
release_history: * Abyss - Added as a base building product.

title: Defence Chit
summary: Defense Chit is a sentinels to fight the pirates alongside you. It is worth noting that the sentinels are typically incapable of defeating the pirates for you. You need to assist them, or flee while the pirates are occupied. Additionally, you can fire upon sentinel starships, intentionally or otherwise, and add them to the number of ships you need to defeat or outrun.
game_description: A token, entitling the bearer to support from the system authorities in dealing with pirate attacks.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a product.
* NEXT - It can be stacked in inventory.

title: Defence Systems Upgrade
summary: Defence Systems Upgrades, contained within upgrades granting bonuses to the exosuit's shield and health.
release_history: * NEXT - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
* Health squares added by a Defence Systems Upgrade start out depleted and will not protect the player from death until they have been replenished by a source of healing.
* Upgrade bonuses trigger for Defence Systems Upgrades if they are adjacent to any Forbidden Exosuit Modules that have Shield Strength bonuses or each other, increasing their combined Shield Strength above listed values. This does not, however, apply to bonuses that try to match a mod with just a sprint distance buff with another mod with only a shield strength buff, like in the forbidden mods.

title: Deflector Shield
summary: Deflector Shield is the standard means of protecting a starship against enemy fire (no collision damage from space objects like asteroids or space stations). It will prevent enemy shots from making contact with the ship, but will regenerate slowly while not fully charged, necessitating manual recharge with Sodium, Sodium Nitrate or Starshield Battery for meaningful durability extension in combat. If not recharged and permitted to deplete, the shield will drop, leaving the starship vulnerable to critical damage.
game_description:
Energy shield that protects spacecraft from laser fire, in-flight projectiles and accidental space debris interaction.

User is advised that catalytic elements are required to recharge device.

Operates automatically once constructed within user's starship inventory.
release_history:
* Release - Added as a technology.
* NEXT - Ablative Armour and procedurally generated Deflector Shield Upgrades added, while Sigma/Tau/Theta upgrades removed. No collision damage from space objects (asteroids or space stations). Formerly Heridium and Carite Sheet needed for repair. Previously oxide elements or any Shielding products used for recharging.
additional_info: *Upgrade bonuses trigger if Deflector Shield is adjacent to Ablative Armour or Deflector Shield Upgrades, indirectly improving the technology by augmenting the effects of its upgrades.

infobox.desc: Energy shield that protects spacecraft from laser fire, in-flight projectiles and accidental space debris interaction.

title: Deflector Shield Upgrade
summary: Deflector Shield Upgrades, contained within Starship Shield Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to the Deflector Shield of the starship.
release_history: * NEXT - Added as a technology.
additional_info: * Upgrade bonuses trigger for Deflector Shield Upgrades if they are adjacent to

title: Dish Receptor Antenna
summary:
Dish Receptor Antenna is an item used in base building. 

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Station.
game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component

title: Draped Sail Timber Roof
summary:
Draped Sail Timber Roof is a Base building structure used to erect basic structures.

The basic component's preview auto-snaps to the edges of other basic components.
game_description:
Reinforced Timber building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibilty with other prefab structurs. Rapid Grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts
release_history: * Frontiers - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: *The blueprint is learned from a Construction Research Unit, or Construction Research Station.

title: Drawn Cart
summary:
Drawn Cart is an item used in base building. 

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Station.
game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component

title: Dream Aerial
summary: Dream Aerial is a curiosity used to locate Organic Frigates.
game_description:
A signal receiver and amplifier, tuned to the wavelength of the unconscious mind. It is every colour all at once, splitting the surrounding light into a shimmering rainbow.

Warning: Carrying this antenna into deep space may attract the attention of cosmic megafauna.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from frigate expeditions.
use_info:
With the Dream Aerial in your inventory, you can locate Organic Frigates by pulsing through space.

If the first frigate you meet does not match your needs (for example it is not S class), you can refuse it by canceling during inspection. The game will keep offering you living frigates until you accept one.

Each system has exactly one living frigate it can offer.  Unlike a frigate which allows you to re-roll the class by reloading, the frigate's name and class are always the same in the same system. If you reject the first one you find, you must switch to another system to get one with a different class.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a curiosity.
additional_info:
The Dream Aerial can only locate one organic frigate on its own. After the first one, you have to have an active Anomaly Detector to find another organic frigate (you can only get one per system). Just pulse drive into nowhere and exit the pulse only when "Whalesong detected" notification is displayed - ignore all the other Rare Deep Space objects.

A list of documented frigates can be found in the Starship Catalogue - Frigate.

title: Dredging Laser
summary: Dredging Laser provides Terrain Manipulator capabilities to the Nautilon's Tethys Beam.
game_description:
Adds Terrain Manipulation capability to the laser systems of the Nautilon Submarine.

Cooled by specially designed water intakes, it is specifically calibrated to carve through complex geology of the sea floor.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - Added as a technology.

title: Drift Suspension
summary: Drift Suspension is a technology which changes the handling characteristics of an Exocraft, making it drift easily.
game_description:
Overhauls Exocraft handling values through a combination of software tweaks, pressure adjustments and the insertion of microgravity wells into key suspension components.

Specifically tuned to increase the ability of the Exocraft to drift.
release_history: * NEXT 1.63 - Added as a technology.

title: Drone Alert Poster
summary: Posters are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description: Self-adhesive, crease-proof wall art.
source_info: Blueprint can be purchased from the Construction Research Station for 1 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component.

title: Dual-Pronged Antenna
summary:
Dual-Pronged Antenna is an item used in base building. 

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Station.
game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component

title: Dyson Pump
summary: Dyson Pump is a technology that augments the Cyclotron Ballista, a starship weapon. Its effects stack with those provided by Cyclotron Ballista Upgrades, but this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for triggering stronger upgrade bonuses on those upgrades.
game_description:
Replaces the heat sink of the Cyclotron Ballista by encompassing the entire unit with a heat-absorbing megastructure. Heat output is recycled to boost combat efficiency.

Significantly improves heat performance.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used TetraCobalt.
additional_info: The in-game description incorrectly refers to hint sink, instead of heat sink.

title: Economy Scanner
summary:
Economy Scanner is a starship technology and allows the player to check a star system's economy in the Galactic Map without having to warp to that system.

Without it, the player would have to actually warp to the system to check its economy. The scanner allows this research to be done without ever having to warp. This saves warp cells and makes it easier for players to find high-economy systems as well as systems of the correct economy type for a trade route.
game_description: An upgrade to the starship's galactic-scale sensors. This device allows the user to access detailed economic data about a system without having to visit.
source_info:
The Economy Scanner can be bought for 150 vendor.

It can also be found by following a distress beacon to a Crashed Ship.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises 1.37 - Added the ability to locate Trading Posts from a starship.
* Atlas Rises 1.38 - Added error message when no Trading Post is found.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Heridium and Thamium9.
additional_info: * Higher economy means there is a much higher chance that you may find an S-class ship.

infobox.desc: Grants the ability to check a system's economy without having to visit

title: Efficient Thrusters
summary: Efficient Thrusters are a starship technology and an upgrade for the Launch Thruster.
game_description: Upgrades the starship launch systems, decreasing the fuel cost of takeoff.
source_info: This technology can be acquired from the starship technology researcher on board the Space Anomaly for 120 Nanites.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Beyond - Blueprint location moved to the Space Anomaly from Space Stations.
additional_info:
* This technology provides a flat increase and does not benefit from an Upgrade bonus trigger by placing it directly next to the Launch Thrusters.
* When present in a ship, the launch fuel cost is multiplied by 0.8 (a +20% fuel efficiency bonus), taking the fuel usage from 25% per launch to 20% per launch. 
* Although not possible in standard gameplay, adding more instances of Efficient Launch Thrusters to a ship will reduce the cost further. However, the added efficiency bonus decreases with each added unit (-5% for one unit (20% launch cost), -4% for two units (16% launch cost), -3.2% for three units (12.8% launch cost), -2.6% for four units (10.24% launch cost), so on) making the space requirements quite costly should the user wish to vastly increase fuel efficiency.

title: Efficient Water Jets
summary:
Efficient Water Jets is a technology that allows the player to use their jetpack for faster underwater travel than swimming.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description:
Improves the fuel efficiency of the jetpack's marine jets, reducing the drain on Exosuit life support system.

Aqueous compressor units are installed into the jetpack's turbines, bypassing the large energy requirements of underwater ignition.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from a Technology Merchant for 350
release_history: * Abyss - Added as a technology.
additional_info: It decreases Life Support drain while using the Jetpack underwater threefold.

title: Elaborate Alloy Roof
summary:
Elaborate Alloy Roof is a Base building structure used to erect basic structures.

The basic component's preview auto-snaps to the edges of other basic components.
game_description:
Reinforced Alloy building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibilty with other prefab structurs. Rapid Grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts
release_history: * Frontiers - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: *The blueprint is learned from a Construction Research Unit, or Construction Research Station.

title: Electrical Cloaking Unit
summary: Electrical Cloaking Unit is a base building product that toggles the visibility of connecting lines which indicate electrical wiring when turned on/off.
game_description:
Device to enable a wireless aesthetic in habitable bases.

Constructing the  Electrical Cloaking Unit within a powered base will reduce the visual prominence of all local Electrical Wiring. Hidden wires will continue to supply electricty, provided they are sufficiently powered.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a base building product.
additional_info: * Does not hide Teleport Cables.

title: Electrical Wiring
summary:
Electrical Wire is a base building product that connects various base building products to supply power to them.

Unlike most items in No Man's Sky, it costs nothing to build.
game_description:
High-capacity electrical wiring. Use wiring to connect Power generators to your base. Most technology as well as structures with embedded lighting systems, require a power source to operate.

Wiring can be connected to various switches to facilitate selective power flow.
source_info: This product can be found on the Build menu >> Power & Industry >> Industrial.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
*Wiring does not function when the power devices on each end are part of different bases - even if owned by the same player. No error is displayed in-game and instead just does not function.
*The visual lines indicating the wires can be hidden using a Electrical Cloaking Unit.
*Each individual segment counts as a separate item towards any building limits.

title: Electromagnetic Generator
summary: Electromagnetic Generator is a base building product that generates power from Electromagnetic Power Hotspots and does not need additional fuel to operate. It can be connected to various base building products with Electrical Wiring to supply power to them.
game_description:
When suitably placed in an area of high field strength, efficient electromagnetic dynamos are used to generate near limitless power.

Locate appropriate sites with the Surveying upgrade for the Analysis Visor. Power output will vary from site to site.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly, costing 10 Salvaged Data to unlock.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
Electromagnetic Generators do NOT work across bases.  A hotspot must be within, or close to the boundaries of your base build limit to function properly.  Generators which are part of a different base will show they are directing power, however, the one inside your other base will be un-powered.

You can build multiple generators around the same spot and they will all generate about the same amount of power.  If one generates 150kps building and connecting four will give you 600kps.

title: Emergency Signal Scanner
summary:
Emergency Signal Scanner is a derelict freighters.

They are considered an expensive item and prices may escalate in accordance with demand. Prices start from 5M
game_description:
A single-use receiver that scans for distress signals on freighter frequencies. Derelict or abandoned freighters often contain high-value salvage.

Select the Receiver and use Tune Signal (X/Xbox; 'E'/PC or File:PSBUTTON.SQUARE.png/PS4) to begin the location process.
source_info:
*Can be purchased from the Scrap Dealer aboard the Space Station.
*Can be received as a reward from Nexus missions.
*Iteration: Helios aboard the Space Anomaly offers a free Emergency Signal Scanner each week
release_history:
* Desolation - This item was added to the game as technology.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Emergency Broadcast Receiver".
* Waypoint - Iteration: Helios no longer offers a free Emergency Signal Scanner each week.
* Update 4.25 - Iteration: Helios offers a free Emergency Signal Scanner each week again.
additional_info:
* After activation, you need to travel via pulse drive in any direction to detect a derelict freighter.
* If standard exosuit inventory is full and more than one scanner is owned, activation will fail as "Receiver Temporarily Jammed"; one slot must be clear for a scanner to convert to the "active" form.
* If the scanner is placed in the Personal Refiner, it will not be consumed upon opening the airlock and will become inactive upon completion of the derelict.

title: Emergency Warp Unit
summary: Emergency Warp Unit is a starship technology that allows escape from combat by warping to the nearest  star system. It can be used anywhere other than a planet. Prior to Synthesis it was always possible to escape combat by warping.
game_description:
A significant upgrade to the Hyperdrive that allows an instantaneous warp even while conventional systems are blocked by starship combat. Access to the emergency warp system is via the Quick Menu.

WARNING: Fast scramble systems mean the user is unable to plot a destination. Uncalculated lightspeed events will damage the unit and require frequent repairs.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Hyperion on board Space Anomaly for 240
release_history: * Synthesis - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
* Gives a bonus to hyperdrive range if the upgrade module is installed adjacent to the ship's hyperdrive or other drive modules.  
*Has no organic counterpart, so it’s not possible to emergency warp on a living ship.
* Will be instantly damaged after every emergency warp.

title: Environment Control Unit
summary: Environment Control Unit is a hazard protection upgrade for the Exocraft.
game_description:
A powerful environmental neutralising system is plugged directly into the Minotaur pilot when they take control of the vehicle. The system is powered via the Minotaur's main engine unit and requires no additional user inputs. Some minor pain may be noticed around the insertion site.

Renders the Minotaur pilot impervious to all environmental hazards.
release_history: *ExoMech - Added as a technology

title: Excavation Claw
summary:
Excavation Claw' is an item used in base building. 

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Station.
game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component

title: Exocraft Boosters
summary: Exocraft Boosters is a propulsion upgrade for the Exocraft.
game_description: An efficient plasma injector coupled to the engine that allows short bursts of speed.
release_history: * Waypoint - Renamed from "Exocraft Acceleration Module" to "Exocraft Boosters".
additional_info: The upper case name that is displayed in the blueprint is "Exocraft Boost Module". The lower case name "Exocraft Boosters" is displayed in the tech install select menu.

title: Exocraft Boosters Upgrade
summary: Exocraft Boosters Upgrades, contained within Exocraft Boost Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to the Exocraft's boosters.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - introduced into the game as an upgrade module.
* Beyond - Formula changed, previously used Technology Module.
* Waypoint - Name changed, was "Exocraft Acceleration Module Upgrade".
additional_info: * Upgrade bonuses trigger for Exocraft Boosters Upgrades if they are adjacent to Exocraft Boosters or each other, increasing their bonuses above listed values.

infobox.image: NmsTech Exocraft Acceleration Module Upgrade Icon.png

title: Exocraft Mining Laser
summary: The Exocraft Mining Laser is a weapon which can be mounted on any Exocraft, but comes pre-installed on the Colossus. It can be fired continuously without ever overheating, dealing damage at an apparent tick rate of 5 ticks per second until its energy is depleted, at which point it must be recharged with Carbon (0.5%/unit), Condensed Carbon (1.5%/unit) or Oxygen (1%/unit).
game_description: A mining laser too cumbersome for handheld operation, they are found only installed on Exocraft.
additional_info:
* The weapon actually deals damage 10 times per second, but pairs of damage ticks are automatically added together to reduce clutter for the purposes of damage number display.
* This technology has one blueprint upgrade, Exocraft Mining Laser Upgrade Sigma, and a dedicated Upgrade Module type, Exocraft Laser Module.
* As it does not yield resources until it is finished harvesting, it will not attract Sentinel attention in the event of a misfire, so long as it does not finish destroying the object.
* Unlike small-arms Multi-tool weaponry, the mining laser can damage starships and will cause them to fire back on the player.
* A mining laser with the Upgrade Sigma is better at destroying Sentinels and fauna than a stock Exocraft Mounted Cannon

title: Exocraft Radar
summary:
Exocraft Radar is an Navigational Charts of any kind.

Radar Amplifier and Radar Power Resonator can be added to increase its functionality.
game_description:
A large and complex field-based subspace radar.

Due to their large power consumption and inherent subatomic instability, they are found only installed on Exocraft.
release_history: * Waypoint - Renamed, formerly Exocraft Signal Booster.

title: Exocraft Specialist's Room
summary: '''Exocraft Specialist's Room''' is a Freighter Base Building module accomodating Technician terminal.
game_description:
Integrated freighter research equipment tailored to the needs of exocraft mechanics, and equipped with bespoke vehicular design software.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Exocraft Summoning Unit
summary: Exocraft Summoning Unit is an Exosuit technology that allows summoning of an Exocraft.
game_description:
A high-powered matter teleportation device, this personal translocator allows any connected Exocraft to be instantly transported to your location, from anywhere in the galaxy.

Interfaces with the Exosuit Quick Menu for ease of use.
source_info: This blueprint can be bought from the Exosuit upgrade merchant on the Space Anomaly.
release_history: * Worlds Part II - Added as a technology.

title: Exosuit Expansion Unit
summary: Exosuit Expansion Unit is a general inventory or technology slot by one up to a limit.
game_description:
An advanced survival technology module that allows expansion of a user's Exosuit Storage.

Pre-packed nano-expanders create stablised sub-warp voids within the Exosuit, increasing its inventory capacity. Apply this augmentation at the Exosuit upgrade terminal on board a Space Station.
source_info:
*Harmonic Scrap (4.5%)
*Mission Board (2-4%)
*Some Envoys (Master rank and above with Explorers Guild)
use_info: Locate an Exosuit Upgrade Console near the Technology Merchant that sells Exosuit Upgrades on the left-hand side of any Space Station. If you have already bought the Exosuit Slot Upgrade from this specific console and you have an Exosuit Expansion Unit in your/your ship's inventory, open the console again and you'll be able to add a new slot, consuming the expansion unit.
release_history:
* Expeditions - added as a curiosity.
* Waypoint - icon changed. Can now be rewarded from mission board missions.

title: Exosuit Upgrade Chart
summary: Exosuit Upgrade Chart is a Constructed Technology and can be activated in one's inventory to locate a Drop Pod.
game_description:
Encoded navigation data which, when properly decrypted, will reveal the location of a Drop Pod containing an Exosuit Inventory Upgrade.

Select the coordinates in the inventory and use Plot Route to pin the location in your Exosuit display.
source_info:
* Can be purchased on Nexus missions.
* Can be occasionally purchased at Trade Outposts at the Galactic Trade Terminal
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a curiosity. It has the same icon as Network Interface.
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Drop Pod Coordinate Data". Icon changed.

title: Explosive Drones
summary: Explosive Drones is a consumable product and one of the upgrades available for frigates. It is a temporary upgrade which boosts the Combat capabilities of a frigate fleet for a single expedition by 10 points.
game_description:
A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition.

This pack of autonomous explosives have been programmed to launch from the fleet and pilot themselves directly towards hostile vessels. Extremely dangerous.
source_info:
* The product's blueprint is a possible reward from a Manufacturing Facility or Operations Centre.
* The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for one Salvaged Frigate Module.
* A possible drop from Sentinel starships.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a product, with frigate-related function. It has the same icon as Comet Droplets and Solenoid.
* Beyond - Added an ability to research a blueprint at the Freighter Research Terminal.

title: Exterior Catwalk
summary: Exterior Catwalk is a base building product specifically designed for freighters.
game_description:
This exterior wakway intelligently adjoins to existing freighter roons, creating decking outside the hull of large starships.

A Bulkhead Door must be installed to allow access to exterior spaces.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a product.

title: Exterior Platform
summary: Exterior Platform is a base building product specifically designed for freighters.
game_description:
An unsheltered observation deck. Allows the user to step outside the freighter hull, and gaze directly into the vastness of spaceThis exterior wakway intelligently adjoins to existing freighter roons, creating decking outside the hull of large starships.

A Bulkhead Door must be installed to allow access to exterior spaces.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a product.

summary:

game_description:

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibilty with other prefab structurs. Rapid Grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts

title: Factory Override Unit
summary: Factory Override Unit is a advanced research modules.
game_description:
A portable data unit, compatible with most planetary fabricator facilities.

Once access has been gained to a central control terminal, the Override Unit can divert the facilities resources towards researching new product recipes.
source_info:
There is a chance you get 1 or 2 if you successfully override a Manufacturing Facility.

It can be gained as a reward from a mission from The Nexus.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a curiosity.
* Waypoint - Icon changed.
additional_info:
It is not recommended to sell these, as the crafted products researched with this technology can get you much more money.

As of Endurance, 44 Factory Override Units are required to learn all recipes; 13 for components and devices, and 31 for Valuable products.

title: Fleet Command Room
summary: Fleet Command Room is a base building product specifically designed for freighters, and used as a control center for a frigate fleet.
game_description:
Core Fleet Management Station. This advanced holographic communications station is vital for managing fleet expeditions from the comfort of your capital ship.

User is advised that a dedicated station is required to manage each fleet that will be sent on an expedition at a time, for example to have five simultaneous fleet expeditions, five of these terminal rooms will be required.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.51 - Fixed an issue where players were unable to build it in Creative mode.
* Endurance - New look and icon
* Waypoint - New look
additional_info: Fleet Command Stations in use display their assigned fleets. For active fleets, the ships are rotating (cyan color), while those awaiting debrief are stationary (green color).

title: Flight Assist Override
summary: Flight Assist Override is a starship technology that increases Pulse Engine maneuverability.
game_description:
This grey-market electronics module disables critical safety and pilot-assistance modules usually baked into the starship's fly-by-wire control system. Despite its dubious legal status and its implication in a series of high-speed asteroid impacts, this module remains popular with smugglers, mercenaries, and others who think of themselves as advanced pilots.

Specifically tuned to increase the ability of the starship to drift during spaceflight.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Hyperion on board Space Anomaly for 460
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology.
additional_info: * Gives a bonus to the speed and maneuverability if the upgrade is installed next to the Pulse Engine or other Pulse Engine Upgrades.

title: Flight Path Poster
summary: Posters are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description: Self-adhesive, crease-proof wall art.
source_info: Blueprint can be purchased from the Construction Research Station for 1 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component.

title: Floor Switch
summary: Floor Switch is a base building product that is used to toggle power to buildings using Electrical Wiring.
game_description:
A power management device, the switch will toggle the flow of power when stood upon or otherwise activated.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.
additional_info:
* The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for 1 Salvaged Data.
* The product will activate when a player is standing on it (measuring a 6x6u square) and deactivate again once no player is standing on it. This makes it useful for powering base products that only need to be powered when a player is nearby, such as Galactic Trade Terminal or Storage Container.
** Note: Leaving by the Base Teleport Module does not appear to trigger the Floor Switch to turn off.
