title: Forbidden Exosuit Module
summary: Forbidden Exosuit Modules, contained within upgrades that grant various bonuses to your exosuit.
release_history: *SentinelUp - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
* Core health units added by Forbidden Exosuit Modules start out depleted and will not protect the player from death until they have been replenished by a source of healing.
* Adjacency upgrade bonuses trigger for Forbidden Exosuit Module, Defence Systems Upgrades, and Salvaged Upgrade Componentss. If they have common stats they share such as Shield Strength, the stat bonus can be increased above listed values. This does not, however, apply adjacency bonuses to other upgrades such as Life Support and its upgrades or the Jetpack and its upgrades, despite sharing some of these stats.
* Note that extra core health granted by these modules may not be a beneficial stat late-game, as it is possible to max out with 9 core health units using only Defence Systems Upgrades, Remembrance, and Star Seed/Mark of the Denier.  Further core health stat bonuses have no effect, so it may be better to choose a different 4th stat to pump.

title: Fossil Display
summary:
Fossil Display is a Base building decorative structure used to reassemble and showcase Ancient Bones excavated from Fossil Beds. Fossil Displays allow Travellers to arrange bones into complete animal forms for display within their bases.

A Fossil Display can be deployed on any planetary surface or inside a Freighter Base.
game_description:
A display stand designed to showcase the recovered remains of ancient lifeforms. Once placed, ancient bones can be arranged to re-create countless animal forms. A complete fossil requires a skull, a ribcage, two sets of limbs, and a tail.

Create a museum of assembled fossils at your base, or package your exhibits for trade on the open market, or with other Travellers. Find alien Fossil Collectors to trade with aboard Space Stations or at planetary Palaeontological Digs.
release_history: * Relics — This item was added as part of the Relics update, alongside the Collecting Fossils mission.
additional_info: * The blueprint is learned from a Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly after starting the Collecting Fossils mission.

title: Fourier De-Limiter
summary: Fourier De-Limiter is a technology that augments the Phase Beam, a starship weapon. Its effects stack with those provided by Phase Beam Upgrades, but this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for triggering stronger Upgrade bonuses on those upgrades.
game_description:
Rewires the Phase Beam with nanite-based circuitry, bypassing conventional reality limits on laser power.

Significantly improves heat performance.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Salt Refractor.

title: Fragment Supercharger
summary:
Fragment Supercharger is a technology that augments the Positron Ejector, a starship weapon, by increasing its range from 750u to 937.5u (without accounting for upgrade bonuses) while keeping its max-range spread at a similar size.

Its effects stack with those provided by Positron Ejector Upgrades, but this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for triggering stronger upgrade bonuses on those upgrades.
game_description:
Overhauls the firing mechanism of the Positron Ejector, resulting in faster, more accurate particles.

Improves range and accuracy.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, now uses Wiring Loom instead of Technology Module
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Rare Metal Element.

title: Freighter Corridor
summary: Freighter Corridor is a Base building structure designed to connect rooms together within a Freighter. This freighter component is only buildable within the designated build area.
game_description:
This expansion module allows for the rapid construction of habitable spaces inside large starships.

Construction unit is fabricated complete with pressure bulkhead and all necessary attachment points.
release_history: * NEXT - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: * This item serves the same purpose as a Straight Corridor does for a planetary base.

title: Freighter Corridor (Endurance)
summary: Freighter Corridor is a base building product specifically designed for freighters.
game_description:
This pressurised corridor intelligently adjoins to existing freighter rooms, connecting habitable spaces inside large starships.

This flexible corridor piece will automatically expand and contract to form curves or junctions when placed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a product.

title: Freighter Cross Junction
summary: Freighter Cross Junction is a Base building structure designed to connect rooms together within a Freighter. This freighter component is only buildable within the designated build area.
game_description:
This expansion module allows for the rapid construction of habitable spaces inside large starships.

Construction unit is fabricated complete with pressure bulkhead and all necessary attachment points.
release_history: * NEXT - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info:
* This item serves the same purpose as an X-Shaped Corridor does for a planetary base.
* The Cross Junction can not be installed on the 1st level Freighter deck.

title: Freighter External Stairs
summary: Freighter External Stairs is a base building product specifically designed for freighters.
game_description:
A sturdy, non-slip staircase with an ergonomic incline, for traversing vertically between freighter decks.

These robust stairs can be affixed outside the freighter hull, creating connections between exterior catwalks and platforms.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a product.

title: Freighter Glass Corridor
summary: Freighter Corridor is a base building product specifically designed for freighters.
game_description:
This pressurised corridor intelligently adjoins to existing freighter rooms, connecting habitable spaces inside large starships. The low-expansion, radiation-proof glass ceiling allows a view into deep space.

This flexible corridor piece will automatically expand and contract to form curves or junctions when placed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a product.

title: Freighter Glass Stairs
summary: Freighter Glass Stairs is a base building product specifically designed for freighters.
game_description:
A sturdy, non-slip staircase with an ergonomic incline, for traversing vertically between freighter decks.

Constructed from low thermal expansion glass, these stairs provide the user with a thrilling view into deep space.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a product.

title: Freighter Hyperdrive
summary:
Freighter Hyperdrive is the freighter's lightspeed propulsion drive to aid players travel across galaxies. It has a base range of 100 light-years.

By default, each warp between systems consumes 20% of the hyperdrive's fuel supply. A freighter hyperdrive is fully charged with 5 Warp Cells or one Warp Hypercore.
Installing hyperdrive upgrade modules found in Derelict Freighters will increase a range and may reduce fuel consumption just like in a regular Starship.
game_description:
FTL propulsion drive that allows starship to attain warp speed and jump between neighbouring systems.

Charge equipment with Warp Cell or Warp Hypercore.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a technology.
* Beyond - Introduced the upgrade tree.
* Synthesis - Added coloured system upgrades to the upgrade tree, increased base range to 101 ly.
* Desolation - Added Freighter Hyperdrive Upgrade modules, increased maximum hyperdrive bonus to 80%, changed hyperdrive charging requirements, previously required only one Warp Cell.

title: Freighter Junction
summary: Freighter Junction is a Base building structure designed to connect rooms together within a Freighter. This freighter component is only buildable within the designated build area.
game_description:
This expansion module allows for the rapid construction of habitable spaces inside large starships.

Construction unit is fabricated complete with pressure bulkhead and all necessary attachment points.
release_history: * NEXT - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: * This item serves the same purpose as a T-Shaped Corridor does for a planetary base.

title: Freighter Stairs
summary: Freighter Stairs is a Base building structure designed to connect rooms at different elevations together within a Freighter. This freighter component is only buildable within the designated build area.
game_description:
This expansion module allows for the rapid construction of habitable spaces inside large starships.

Construction unit is fabricated complete with pressure bulkhead and all necessary attachment points.
release_history:
* NEXT - This item was added as a base-building component.
* Endurance - Removed from the list of base-building components.
additional_info: * This item has no true large-structure equivalent; however, its function is similar to that of Interior Stairs.

title: Freighter Stairs (Endurance)
summary: Freighter Stairs is a base building product specifically designed for freighters.
game_description: A sturdy, non-slip staircase with an ergonomic incline, for traversing vertically between freighter decks.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a product.

title: Freighter Storage Unit
summary:
Freighter Storage Units allow a player to store resources and products above and beyond what is available in a starship or exosuit inventory.

A maximum of ten storage units (labelled 0 through 9) may be built on a Freighter, with each container holding 20 stacks. Each stack will hold 9999 units of a specific resource (1000 in Survival mode), or four times as many of any other items (with the exception of Upgrade Modules) as each slot of the exosuit's inventory can hold.
game_description:
Hybrid high-capacity storage unit / shelving module for installation in interstellar freighters.

Compatible with all standard life-support fittings.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.60 - Added as a replacement to Storage Containers on freighters.
* Endurance - Deprecated and replaced by Storage Room.
additional_info:
* The player must be near the terminal within a storage unit in order to manually access its contents.
* Storage units are numbered from 0-9 in the Build Menu to correspond with Storage Containers with the same numbers.
* Each number can only be used once within a given freighter. A given storage unit shares its contents with all Storage Container instances with the same number (1 - 1, 2 - 2, and so on).
* Items can be moved from the exosuit, or starship, inventory to storage units while the player is within a freighter build area containing those storage units, or from anywhere with the Matter Beam upgrade installed.
** Items remotely transferred into storage units cannot be directed to a specific unit. Rather, it gets stacked into the first container (in order from 0 to 9) with an open slot. If the container the item would get deposited into already has a stack of that item, it gets stacked.

* Items may be retrieved from a storage unit by
**opening the freighter's inventory menu while the freighter is in the current system, and navigating through each container as if they were additional inventory tabs;
**requesting items to an empty exosuit or starship slot while in the freighter build area, or anywhere else with the Matter Beam upgrade installed in the freighter;
**physically interacting with the unit's terminal and transferring items directly.
*There seems to be a glitch where sometimes you cannot take things out of a certain container, instead showing the description of a technology in the Starship.
** The issue can be circumvented by taking out a different item stack first, allowing the original item stack to be taken but duplicating an item stack in exosuit inventory.

title: Fuel Inverter
summary: Fuel Inverter is a power technology installed in various products to power them and it requires 100 Carbon or 34 Condensed Carbon to be fully charged.
game_description: A piece of rechargeable power technology. The fuel inverter ensures an even flow of power to autonomous machines.
release_history:
*NEXT - added to the game
*Desolation - recharging values changed, used to be 150/50

title: Fuel Oxidiser
summary:
Fuel Oxidiser is a consumable product and one of the upgrades available for frigates. It is a temporary upgrade which reduces the expedition's duration of a frigate fleet for a single expedition by 10 points.

The British spelling of this phrase is used in the wiki.
game_description:
A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition.

This powerful fuel upgrade overloads frigate engines, allowing for faster-than-usual travel.
source_info:
* The product's blueprint is a possible reward from a Manufacturing Facility or Operations Centre.
* The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for one Salvaged Frigate Module.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a product, with frigate-related function. It has the same icon as Fusion Core and Load Balancer.
* Beyond - Added an ability to research a blueprint at the Freighter Research Terminal.

title: Fusion Engine
summary:
Fusion Engine is  an exocraft technology which comes pre-installed in all Exocraft and powers their locomotion systems. As Exocraft would not function without this technology, it cannot be dismantled.

The Fusion Engine has an internal fuel supply which is slowly consumed while the Exocraft is moving normally and more quickly consumed while an Exocraft Acceleration Module is being actively used. If this fuel supply is depleted, the Exocraft will be unable to move until the Fusion Engine is recharged with Carbon (0.33%/unit), Condensed Carbon (1%/unit), or Oxygen (0.67%/unit)
game_description:
A compact fusion core common to all Exocraft.

Requires fuel to function.

title: Fusion Engine Upgrade
summary: Fusion Engine Upgrades, contained within Exocraft Engine Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to an Exocraft's Fusion Engine.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - introduced into the game as an upgrade module.
* Beyond - Formula changed, previously used Technology Module.
additional_info: * Upgrade bonuses trigger for Fusion Engine Upgrades if they are adjacent to Fusion Engine or each other, increasing their bonuses above listed values.

title: Fusion Ignitor
summary:
thumb|Crafting Tree
Fusion Ignitor is a tradeable that can be crafted.
game_description:
A highly advanced piece of technology for use in the next generation of power plants. Producing a fusion core requires both intricate scientific skills and complex industrial processes.

Crafted from Portable Reactor, Quantum Processors and Geodesite.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Manufacturing Facilites or purchased from the Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a product.
* Visions - Value changed, previously it was worth 18,000,000.0
additional_info: It is tied with the Stasis Device for most valuable singular item in the game.

title: Galactic Hub Decal
summary:
Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

This decal is a copy of the Galactic Hub Project logo.
game_description:
thumb|Decal in use
An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.

This decal depicts an emblem bearing the mission statement: "Explore Together'.
release_history: * NEXT 1.58 - added as a base-building component.

title: Galactic Trade Room
summary: Galactic Trade Room is a Freighter Base Building module replacing Galactic Trade Terminal.
game_description:
Integrated freighter equipment providing instant local access to the galactic trade market for resources and commodities.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Galactic Trade Terminal
summary:
250px|thumb|Galactic Market terminal
A Galactic Trade Terminal provides access to the Galactic Market; where a player can trade, sell, and purchase items. 

Terminals of this type are found on space stations, and various Point of Interest locations on a planet. They provide quick electronic access to galactic markets where items of various types may be bought or sold on the open market.

Players can build these terminals on a base or freighter.
game_description: A trading terminal that provides instant local access to the market for resources and products.
use_info: left|600x600px
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a base building product.
* Beyond 2.09.1 - Fixed an issue that caused trade terminals on freighters to intersect the floor (fix will apply to new terminals, old terminals will need to be repositioned manually).
*Update 3.60 (Frontiers) - Removed the power requirement

infobox.desc: Electronic access to the galactic markets

game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component

title: Gas Extractor
summary: Gas Extractor is a base building product that can be used to automatically harvest atmospheric gases.
game_description: An automated gas harvester. Identify a Surveying upgrade for the Supply Depots with Supply Pipes to allow collection from more convenient sites.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly, costing 10 Salvaged Data to unlock.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a base building product.
additional_info:
Available gases for extraction vary from planet to planet and biome to biome. 
* Nitrogen
* Oxygen
* Radon
* Sulphurine
*Methane

title: Gek Decal
summary:
Decals are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

This decal is a stylized Gek logo.
game_description: Placeable decorative decals.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a base-building component.
* Frontiers - renamed, formerly "Decal".

title: Gek Hypnosis Poster
summary: Posters are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description: Self-adhesive, crease-proof wall art.
source_info: Blueprint can be purchased from the Construction Research Station for 1 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component.

title: Generator Coupling
summary:
Generator Coupling is a power technology installed in various products to power them.

It requires 100 Carbon or 37 Condensed Carbon to be fully charged.
game_description: The generator coupling is an important piece of the machine's rechargeable power systems. Without it, the generator would fruitlessly spin, pumping power out into the void.
release_history: * NEXT - Added as a technology. It has the same icon as Pressure Chamber.

title: Geobay
summary:
Geobays are created to provide a safe parking lot for Exocraft. There are separate geobays for each of the five types of Exocraft. Geobays can be placed anywhere, inside or outside of a claimed base. When a geobay is destroyed, the resources used to build it are returned.

All geobays have two terminals. One terminal, with a blue screen, is used to respawn the geobay's Exocraft; the other terminal, with an orange screen, grants access to Exocraft cosmetic customisation.

Note: the Nautilon uses a Nautilon Chamber instead of a Geobay.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - Geobays can now be used to customise their respective Exocraft
* ExoMech - Added a Minotaur geobay
* Expeditions - blueprint formula changed, previously all geobays used Paraffinium and Ion Battery

title: Geodesite
game_description: Geodesite is a tradeable that is used for crafting.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a component.
* NEXT - Now it can also be refined.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Geology Cannon Upgrade
summary: Geology Cannon Upgrades, contained within Geology Cannon Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to a Multi-tool's Geology Cannon.
additional_info:
* Upgrade bonuses trigger for Geology Cannon Upgrades if they are adjacent to Geology Cannon or each other, increasing their bonuses above listed values.
*When using a save editor to compare a Plasma Launcher Upgrade with a Geology Cannon Upgrade of the same class, any given five digit Procedural ID will display the same name for both types, but they will always have stats different from each other.

title: Glass
summary: Glass is a tradeable item that can be used in construction and base building. It can also be used for decoration and room parts other than windows.
game_description:
Shatter-proof, scratch-resistant glass with a self-cleaning, UV-cured coating, for general construction use.

Refined from Silicate powder. Extract silicate from the earth with a Terrain Manipulator.

Can be crafted from Frost Crystals extracted from plants on frozen worlds.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* NEXT 1.64 - Fixed an issue where players could fail to learn the Glass blueprint at the correct time.
* Beyond - Players can now refine 40 Silicate Powder into 1 Glass.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Glass Tunnel
summary:
Glass Tunnel is a base building product which is the underwater-exclusive equivalent of Straight Corridor.

This structure's preview auto-snaps to many horizontal anchors.
game_description:
Pressurised, reinforced glass tunnels for deep-sea construction.

Advanced nano-mineral coating ensures high performance at depth, without compromising visibility.
source_info: The blueprint is awarded as part of Dreams of the Deep; however, it can also be unlocked early using a Blueprint Analyser.
release_history: * Abyss - Added as a base building product.

title: Grantine
summary: Grantine is a tradeable.
game_description:
Soft workable alloy favored by artisans throughout the known galaxy. Crafted from Ionised Cobalt and Dioxite.

title: Hardframe Body
summary: Hardframe Body is a weapon which can be mounted on a Minotaur.
game_description:
A collection of salvaged components from a Sentinel Hardframe, reconditioned to fit the Minotaur Heavy Exocraft Hybrid.

Will function as a semi-autonomous artificial pilot plugin. Installation allows the Minotaur to traverse planets itself and engage in combat or mining activities to support its primary operator.

The AI pilot will always cede control to the primary operator when they enter the cockpit.
release_history:
* SentinelUp - Added as a technology.
* Outlaws - Formula changed, formerly required two of both antimatter and life support gel
* Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Sentinel Hardframe Body".
additional_info: There are adjacency bonuses with the AI pilot and the Liquidator Body, but the bonuses are unknown.

infobox.stats:
Mining Laser Power: +62%
Damage to stunned entities: +400%
Post-Impact Ignition: Enabled
Impact Fire Duration: 4 seconds

A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition.

This powerful analytic computer overclocks the existing fleet systems, allowing for faster-than-light calculations. Heat is a problem, and the chips do not last long.

title: Humboldt Drive
summary: Humboldt Drive is an exocraft technology required for the propulsion of the Nautilon. It uses Hydrothermal Fuel Cell (100%/unit) as a fuel source.
game_description:
A thermally-efficient, inversion-proof reactor engine capable of powering the Nautilon even at extreme depths.

Powered by Hydrothermal Fuel Cells.
source_info:
Humboldt Drive's blueprint is always known, but the player may not need to use the blueprint depending on when they first summon the Nautilon by building a Nautilon Chamber.
* If the player builds the Nautilon Chamber for the first time after acquiring its blueprint from Dreams of the Deep, Humboldt Drive will already be installed in the Nautilon.
* If, instead, the player builds the Nautilon Chamber for the first time before completing the quest step in Dreams of the Deep that normally awards the blueprint (by learning the blueprint from the Blueprint Analyser), the Nautilon will not have Humboldt Drive, forcing the player to install one manually in order to travel underwater with the exocraft.

title: Humboldt Drive Upgrade

release_history:

* Beyond - Formula changed, previously used Technology Module.
additional_info: * Upgrade bonuses trigger for Humboldt Drive Upgrades if they are adjacent to Humboldt Drive, Osmotic Generator or each other, increasing their bonuses above listed values.

title: Hydraulic Wiring
summary: Hydraulic Wiring is a component that is used for crafting.
game_description:
Specialist wiring and control threads, this flexible material allows the transmission of power and signals, as well as offering direct manipulation of remote components.

Used in the creation of a wide range of advanced technologies.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
*Origins - Added as a product.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Hyperdrive
summary:
The Hyperdrive is the yellow coloured systems. Installing proper hyperdrive upgrades, bought from Technology Merchant, in the ship will boost the range and create synergy. That doesn't mean it is advised to install the new hyperdrives in the technology slots. The technology slots are best used to activate a secondary synergy chain to specialize once your former module count reached its limit of 3 upgrades in the general cargo slots. If a player makes a mistake, they can now transfer the technology to the general inventory and back again.

The Cadmium Drive, Emeril Drive and Indium Drive upgrades do not count to the upgrade limit and can fill up general slots easily. Initially these drives didn't activate a synergy bonus, but later this ability was re-implemented. However they do not have abilities that can be boosted, so they should be build near actual modules to offer the synergy to them.
game_description:
FTL propulsion drive that allows starship to attain warp speed and jump between neighbouring systems.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems through Galactic Map.
source_info:
Once you’ve mastered the basics of Base building, you’ll receive an emergency broadcast coming from the nearby Space station. If you haven’t explored it already, you’ll find that Space Stations are home to various life-forms that can give you items, directions, and more (if you can get the general idea of what they are saying). You'll also find a trade hub to buy and sell items, and kiosks to buy blueprints and modifications using Nanites.

Ask the various life forms questions until you find one that has a mysterious message to you; it will send you back to your base planet with the location of a Distress Signal.

Heading back down to the planet, you’ll come across a huge Crashed Freighter, with debris everywhere. Look around for a pod with the transmission that was broadcasting. Request the logs to find a Hyperdrive blueprint.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - Hidden changes: Synergy for special drives re-added.
* Synthesis - Added Emergency Warp Unit as an upgrade, changed base range to 101 LY.
additional_info:
* The pre-order starships centre of the galaxy to another one. The jump can only be made from a gateway system.
* Hyperdrive is one of the only technologies that can be crafted but not dismantled.
* The Blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Hyperion for 1 nanite.
** It could also be bought during Expedition 9: Utopia.
*Typically in science fiction, a "hyperdrive" and "warp drive" are two separate concepts (a hyperdrive uses alternate dimensions to go FTL and a warp drive bends spacetime to go FTL). However, No Man's Sky uses the terms interchangeably.

infobox.desc: FTL propulsion drive for warp speed

title: Hyperdrive (Atlas)
summary:
Hyperdrive is the starship's lightspeed propulsion drive to aid players travel across galaxies. It is also known as warp drive.

Basic hyperdrive has a specific range, which can be improved by the Warp Reactor upgrades (see below). Warp Cells are used to charge this technology.
game_description: FTL propulsion drive that allows starships to attain warp speed and travel between neighbouring star systems. User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems through Galactic Map.

infobox.desc: FTL propulsion drive for warp speed

title: Hyperdrive Upgrade
summary: Hyperdrive Upgrades, contained within Hyperdrive Modules, are upgrades granting bonuses to the Hyperdrive of a Starship.
additional_info:
* Upgrade bonuses trigger for Hyperdrive Upgrades if they are adjacent to Hyperdrive or each other, increasing their Hyperdrive Range bonuses above listed values. Installing Cadmium Drive, Emeril Drive, and Indium Drive as well as the Emergency Warp Unit adjacent to other Hyperdrive Upgrades also increases Hyperdrive Range bonuses.
* At the maximum three upgrades, a Hyperdrive can get 2,200 [S] - 2,500 [X] ly and ten jumps/warp cell

title: Hyperdrive technology
summary: Hyperdrive is not provided with the original Life Pod systems, so will require crafting with the proper blueprints and resources. Videos of gameplay indicate that at least one type of hyperdrive can be crafted with a combination of Silicon and Iridium. The Alpha Vector starship (PS4 pre-orders) and the Horizon Omega starship (PC pre-orders) will both contain hyperdrive technology.

title: Icarus Fuel System
summary: Icarus Fuel System is a solar recharging upgrade for Exocraft.
game_description: The Icarus system takes advantage of existing metal panelling, upgrading them into photovoltaic surfaces. This reactive coating generates energy during daylight hours, offsetting fuel consumption.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology.

title: Illegal Hazard Protection Upgrade
summary: Illegal Hazard Protection Upgrades, contained within Suspicious Hazard Protection Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting various hazard bonuses to your exosuit.
release_history: *Prisms - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
*Underwater Protection Upgrades, or each other, increasing their bonuses above listed values.

*Supercharged Slots use a static, instead of a proportional boost to the stats of these items. For a 10% roll it is possible to get up to 38% total resistance once supercharging has been applied, which can be boosted further with adjacency bonuses. Even on the highest difficulty setting, low hazard will give more than fifteen minutes between charges with this method. Extreme storms will deplete resistance in about a minute with difficulty maxed out, so take rare-earth rechargeables too.

summary:
Illuminated Sign
 is an item used in base building.

title: Impact Igniter
summary: Impact Igniter is a Multi-tool upgrade which causes every projectile from the Pulse Spitter to set its target on fire, as well as deal damage on impact. It is acquired as a blueprint, which blueprint can be purchased from Iteration: Eos for 180
game_description:
A powerful combat upgrade for the Pulse Spitter. This module installs series of delicately calibrated fuel-injection nozzles within the fireing chamber, which are used to initiate a controlled burn within its plasma projectiles

Causes targets hit by the Pulse Spitter to burn for a short while, causing additional damage.
release_history: *SentinelUp - Added to the game.

title: Impossible Membrane
summary:
Impossible Membrane is a curiosity.

It can be obtained at a Korvax Plaque as part of the Starbirth mission.

A biomechanical construct, created to the design of an anonymous host.

A fine mesh of tightly woven fibre. Micro-organisms embedded within the weave allow it to regenerate endlessly, a perfect and infinite bionic skin.

title: Infra-Knife Accelerator
summary: Infra-Knife Accelerator is a weapons technology for the starship. The weapon fires 2 projectiles at once at a very high rate of fire and disperses heat very quickly while not firing, but takes a long time to recover from overheating.
game_description:
A rapid fire starship weapon that launches superheated globes of liquid metal at hostile targets. These projectiles are extremely effective against unshielded starship hulls.

Note: the Accelerator's internal components are vulnerable to rapid overheating. Sustained burst fire is not recommended.

Use () to change weapon mode. Press () to fire.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - Added as a technology.
* NEXT - Nonlinear Optics and procedurally generated Infra-Knife Accelerator Upgrades added, while Sigma/Tau/Theta upgrades removed. Blueprint changed, formerly used Nickel and Platinum.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, formerly used Technology Module instead of Wiring Loom
* Endurance - DPs has significantly increased, making it one of the most potent starsip weapons.
additional_info:
*Infra-Knife Accelerator has the longest overheat recovery time of any starship weapon (the second-longest overheat recovery time, belonging to the Rocket Launcher, is 3 seconds shorter).
*When hitting targets outside of point-blank range, the damage numbers of shots in a volley tend to overlap, making it look like Infra-Knife Accelerator only deals 35 base damage per volley.
**It is not known why damage numbers do not visually combine for this weapon --- damage numbers for Cyclotron Ballista and Positron Ejector, other starship weapons that fire multiple shots in a volley, do visually combine to communicate total volley damage.

title: Infra-Knife Accelerator Upgrade

title: Jetpack
summary:
The jetpack allows the user to fly for short periods of time.

It can be used to reach high places or to explore underground tunnels without fear of getting stuck. Pressing X on the controller or Space on the keyboard will activate the jetpack.
game_description:
Provides the Exosuit with advanced movement capabilities, including temporary flight.

Control thrust with 25px|link=https://nomanssky.gamepedia.com/File:PSBUTTON.X.png/45px|link=https://nomanssky.gamepedia.com/File:Keywide.space.png/25px|link=https://nomanssky.gamepedia.com/File:XBOXBUTTON.A.png (PS4/PC/Xbox). The flightpack uses energy from the Exosuit Life Support system to pressurise and vent bursts of gas, propelling the user into the air.

Jetpack can be temporarily overloaded by gathering Deuterium-rich plants, causing a dramatic increase in available thrust for ten (10) seconds. Consuming a specific cooked product such as Bread will give eight (8) seconds of free thrust per unit.
source_info:
Players are already in possession of the Jetpack when they begin the game.

It is possible to acquire the blueprint. (Possible bug)
release_history:
* Pre-release - seen in a hands-on pre-release video with web personality and occasional Sony collaborator Anthony Carboni who accidentally activated the controls.
* NEXT - repair blueprint changed, formerly used Iron and Heridium; jetpack can be used underwater
additional_info:
* If you believe you are stuck in a location where you can't escape, or just can’t reach your ship, you can jetpack forever whilst pushing against any surface.
* The audio director of Hello Games said he created jetpack sounds by going into the bathroom and recording a hand dryer.
*Despite being impossible to Craft, a placeholder Blueprint is present within the Space Anomaly, with a suggested cost of 100 Ferrite Dust
*Extreme heat makes jetpack more efficient.

infobox.desc: Used as a flight pack to temporarily render the user airborne.

summary:
Decals are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

This decal is a stylized Korvax logo.
game_description: Placeable decorative decals.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a base-building component.
* Frontiers - renamed, formerly "Decal".

summary: Posters are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description: Self-adhesive, crease-proof wall art.
source_info: Blueprint can be purchased from the Construction Research Station for 1 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component.

summary: Posters are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

title: L-Shaped Glass Tunnel
summary:
L-Shaped Glass Tunnel is a base building product which is the underwater-exclusive equivalent of L-Shaped Corridor.

This structure's preview auto-snaps to many horizontal anchors.
game_description:
Pressurised, reinforced glass tunnels for deep-sea construction.

Advanced nano-mineral coating ensures high performance at depth, without compromising visibility.
source_info: The blueprint is awarded as part of Dreams of the Deep; however, it can also be unlocked early using a Blueprint Analyser.
release_history: * Abyss - Added as a base building product.

title: L-Skylight Timber Roof
summary:
L-Skylight Timber Roof is a Base building structure used to erect basic structures.

The basic component's preview auto-snaps to the edges of other basic components.
game_description:
Reinforced Timber building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibilty with other prefab structurs. Rapid Grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts
release_history: * Frontiers - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: *The blueprint is learned from a Construction Research Unit, or Construction Research Station.

title: Ladder Module
summary: Ladder Module is a base building product specifically designed for freighters.
game_description:
An inbuilt freighter ladder for traversing vertically between freighter decks.

Attaches directly to corridors.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a product.

title: Lamp Post
summary:
Lamp Post is an item used in base building. 

The blueprint is acquired from the Construction Research Station.
game_description: Buildable ornament to beautify your base.
release_history: * Frontiers - added as a base-building component

title: Landing Pad
summary:
Landing Pad is a base building product that provides a platform where starships can land and take off. This includes not only the player's ship, but NPC traders. 

*Players may call their ship to a landing pad using Navigation Data.
*Taking off from a landing pad has no Launch Thruster cost.
*Starships will be placed upon available landing pads when teleporting back to the player’s base.
*When constructing a Landing Pad, they can only be attached to the following items:
** any flatpack full-sized wall panel (wooden, concrete, or steel)
** Glass Roofed Corridor
** Straight Corridor
** Cylindrical Room
** Cuboid Room
** Door
game_description:
thumb|Landing Pad attached to a base
A stable, reinforced landing pad for starships.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a base building product.
* NEXT 1.63 - Teleporting back to the player's base places the starship on the landing pad, previously it did not. Fixed an issue that could allow multiple starships to be docked on the same landing pad in multiplayer.
* Beyond - Due to the increase of the size of starships, the landing pad was removed from all existing bases and can be re-acquired by rebuilding them.
additional_info:
* The blueprint is acquired from the Base Computer Archives mission.
* If any sort of structure is placed directly above the Landing Pad, it will prevent NPC ships landing on it.
* When selecting a pad to place it, you may notice a small screen standing upward at the corner. You can rotate the landing pad, and when you do, it will change the direction any ship faces whenever it lands there. The small screen will face away from the left side of the ship - for example, if it is desired that the ship point north after landing, make sure the small screen faces west.

title: Lantern
summary:
Lantern is an item used in base building. There are at least four different varieties:

* Squared Standing Light
* Rounded Standing Light
* Capped Standing Light
* Lantern
game_description: A low-energy consumption light, with an extended lifespan and fully recyclable components.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a base-building component.
* NEXT - blueprint changed, formerly used Heridium and Voltaic Cell.
* Frontiers - renamed, formerly "Light".
additional_info: * Power consumption is 1kP

title: Large Freighter Room A
summary: Large Freighter Room A is a Base building structure designed to hollow out large portions of the interior of a Freighter. This freighter component is only buildable within the designated build area.
game_description:
This expansion module allows for the rapid construction of habitable spaces inside large starships.

Construction unit is fabricated complete with pressure bulkhead and all necessary attachment points.
release_history:
* NEXT - This item was added as a base-building component.
* Frontiers - Renamed, formerly "Large Freighter Room".
additional_info:
This item serves the same purpose as a Cuboid Room does for a planetary base.

There are three freighter room variants:
*

title: Large Rocket Tubes
summary: Large Rocket Tubes is a technology that augments the Rocket Launcher, a starship weapon. Though there are no other Rocket Launcher upgrades, installing this technology next to Rocket Launcher will trigger an upgrade bonus, further increasing its benefits.
game_description: Expands the loading chamber of the starship Rocket Launcher, improving exhaust performance and allowing for significantly faster heat recovery.
release_history:

*Beyond - Blueprint changed, Technology Module was renamed to Wiring Loom.

title: Launch Auto-Charger
summary:
Launch Auto-Charger is a starship technology and an upgrade for the Launch Thruster. 

The recharge rate is 4% per minute. Keep in mind that you need to have your starship grounded and set as your primary before the recharge can take place.
game_description:
Photovoltaic panels fitted to the starship Launch Thrusters allow for a slow trickle charge while the ship is not in operation.

Harvested light is used to fuse di-hydrogen from the atmosphere and over time will refuel the Launch Thrusters automatically.
source_info: This technology can be acquired from the starship technology researcher on board the Space Anomaly for 460 Nanites.
release_history: * Waypoint - Renamed, formerly "Launch System Recharger".

title: Launch Thruster Upgrade
summary: Launch Thruster Upgrades, contained within Launch Thruster Modules, are upgrades granting bonuses to a Starship's Launch Thruster.
release_history: *Expeditions - Expeditions Season 2: Added as a technology.
additional_info: *Upgrade bonuses trigger for Launch Thruster Upgrades if they are adjacent to Launch Thruster, Efficient Thrusters, Launch System Recharger or each other, increasing their bonuses above listed values.

title: Lemmium
summary: Lemmium is a tradeable that can be crafted, found or purchased.
game_description:
Pure Ferrite alloy. Crafted from Pure Ferrite and Uranium. 

Used extensively in starship freighter construction due to its sheer strength. A hardcore material popular on the Galactic Trade Network.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
*Release - Added as a component.
*Atlas Rises - Blueprint changed, formerly used Titanium and Plutonium. Icon changed, formerly used the same as Herox.
*NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Aluminium and Carbon. Now it can also be refined.
*Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.
additional_info:
*Lemmium is named after Lemmy Kilmister, the founder, lead singer and bassist of the English heavy metal band Motörhead. Note additional reference to "hardcore" in the game description.<ref>Will Porter (19 Aug 2016 [https://www.loudersound.com/features/how-i-got-lemmy-into-no-man-s-sky 'How I got Lemmy into No Man's Sky'].</ref>
*The inventory appearance for Lemmium was previously used by Crolium.

title: Life Support Upgrade
summary: Life Support Upgrades, contained within Life Support Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to Life Support.
additional_info:
* Upgrade bonuses trigger for Life Support Upgrades if they are adjacent to Oxygen Recycler or each other, increasing their bonuses above listed values.
* The name generation is extracted from the NMS_LOC4_ENGLISH.MBIN (1.77) game file.

title: Light
summary:
Light is an item used in base building. There are at least four different varieties:

* Light (Regular)
* Light (Handle)
* Light (Lid)
* Light (Round)
game_description: A low energy consumption light, with an extended lifespan and fully recyclable components.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a base-building component.
* NEXT - blueprint changed, formerly used Heridium and Voltaic Cell
additional_info: * Power consumption is 1kP

title: Liquidator Body
summary: Liquidator  Body is a limb replacement which can be mounted on a Minotaur.
game_description:
An upgrade to the Minotaur Heavy Exocraft Hybrid, the Liquidator is a cutting-edge heavy duty combat unit, designed to operate in the harshest of environments.

Will function as a semi-autonomous artificial pilot plugin. Installation allows the Minotaur to traverse planets itself and engage in combat or mining activities to support its primary operator.

The AI pilot will always cede control to the primary operator when they enter the cockpit.
release_history: *Update 5.0 - Worlds Part 1 - Added as a technology.
additional_info: There are adjacency bonuses with the AI pilot and the Hardframe Body, but the bonuses are unknown.

infobox.stats: Allows the Minotaur to assist the player in combat when not in use

title: Liquidator Left Arm
summary:
Liquidator Right Arm is a limb replacement which can be mounted on a Minotaur. It can be obtained by either beating Expedition 14: Liquidators

or it can be purchased for 1000 Quicksilver at the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion.
game_description:
An upgrade to the Minotaur Heavy Exocraft Hybrid, the Liquidator is a cutting-edge heavy-duty combat unit, designed to operate in the harshest of environments.

This limb override also functions as its own dedicated combat system. It deploys high-velocity stun projectiles, perfect for keeping hostiles in place while advancing to close range.

Use <weapon select key> to cycle available weapon modes.
release_history: * Update 5.00 - Added to the game
additional_info: There is an adjacency bonus with the Hardframe Left Arm, but the effect is unknown.

title: Liquidator Right Arm
summary: Liquidator Right Arm is a weapon which can be mounted on a Minotaur.
game_description:
An upgrade to the Minotaur Heavy Exocraft Hybrid, the Liquidator is a cutting-edge heavy-duty combat unit designed to operate in the harshest of environments.

This limb override also functions as its own dedicated combat system - a flamethrower for extreme damage at close range.
release_history: * Update 5.00 - Added as a technology.

title: Living Glass
summary: Living Glass is a tradeable item.
game_description:
An advanced building material, this glass has been imbued with organic compounds that allow it to react to the environment. Microbes within the glass filter harmful light of all wavelengths and balance the atmosphere as required.

Crafted from Lubricant and Glass.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a component.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, the required amount of Glass is increased from 1 to 5.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.
additional_info: The blueprint is rewarded when you construct the Science Terminal and complete the Scientist quest line.

title: Lubricant
summary: Lubricant is a advanced agricultural products.
game_description:
A synthetic lubricant that reduces wear and prolongs the lifespan of technologies with moving parts.

Crafted from Faecium and Gamma Root.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a component.
* Atlas Rises - Blueprint changed, formerly used Mordite.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, formerly used Coprite and Gamma Root.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.
additional_info:
* The blueprint is rewarded when you construct the Science Terminal and begin the Scientist quest line. 
* This is the only agricultural crafted product that allows you to store up to twenty (20) units in a single regular slot rather than the usual five (5) units.

title: Magnetic Resonator
summary: Magnetic Resonator is a component that is used for crafting.
game_description:
An electromagnetic frequency oscillator, able to function in a wide-range of conditions thanks to both ferrous and non-ferrous magnetic properties.

Used in the creation of a wide range of advanced technologies.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Origins - Added as a product.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Magno-Gold
summary: Magno-Gold is a tradeable.
game_description:
Highly prized and lustrous alloy. Popular with traders of all known primary galactic races. Crafted from Ionised Cobalt and Phosphorus.

Easily recognisable by its bright red glow and strong magnetic field.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Pathfinder - Added as a component, renamed from Magmox to Magno-Gold. 
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Gold and Iron.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Marine Shelter
summary:
Marine Shelter is a portable base building product within which the player can take refuge to escape the dangers of the waters. This structure can only be placed underwater. 

The blueprint is primarily acquired from the Dreams of the Deep mission, but it also can be obtained from the Blueprint Analyser prior to the mission.
game_description:
An emergency survival module.

Can be rapidly deployed on the seabed in the event of an oxygen or other Exosuit life support emergency. Provides temporary shelter from environmental hazards, predators and other hostiles forces found in the deep ocean.
additional_info: *Marine Shelter, when dismantled, is returned to inventory as a single item rather than as its construction materials.

title: Mark of the Denier
summary: Mark of the Denier is an Exosuit technology that is the opposite to the Star Seed. The mark adds 1 health point to the Exosuit.
game_description:
A tiny mote of stardust, no more than a speck. On closer examination, its surface is all crystalline shards and distorted crimson geometry.

It flickers with pent-up energy, demanding to be free.

Empower the mark as you discover systems, planets and objects across the universe.
source_info: They can be acquired by completing The Atlas Path, but instead of birth a new star, you need to choose to walk away. After you do so, you will be given a chance to reconsider. If you reconsider, you won't earn this blueprint. The correct choice is to walk away (when given the chance).
release_history: * Omega - Added as a technology.

title: Mass Accelerator
summary:
Mass Accelerator is a Multi-tool upgrade which increases the damage of the Blaze Javelin at full charge (and, by extension, at partial charge as well). The blueprint can be purchased in Space Anomaly.

Mass Accelerator needs to be crafted and then stored in a Multi-tool inventory slot for it to have its effect. Unlike Blaze Javelin Upgrades, this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for enhancing Upgrade bonuses on other upgrades.
game_description:
Extends the firing chamber of the Blaze Javelin, allowing the internal particle accelerators to reach both greater mass and speed.

Significantly improves weapon damage.
release_history:
* NEXT - added as a technology upgrade
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Superoxide Crystal.

title: Matter Beam
summary: The Matter Beam is a freighter technology that allows long distance matter transfer to and from a freighter.
game_description:
A device that modulates standard freighter communication signals to enable the interplanetary transport of matter as well as data.

Freighters fitted with such a device can send and receive products and substances to a user's Exo-suit over a long distance.
source_info: The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for x5 Salvaged Frigate Modules.
release_history:
* Synthesis - Added as a technology that can be researched at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Sodium Diode.
additional_info:
The Matter Beam can teleport items between the Exo-suit and the freighter's main storage, and in addition to any Storage Room built, when the player and the freighter are in the same system.

When the player and freighter are in different systems, or even in different galaxies, items can be teleported only between the Exo-suit and the freighter's main storage.

title: Megawatt Heater
summary: Megawatt Heater  is a hazard protection upgrade for the Exocraft.
game_description:
Installs a powerful heater into the Exocraft, keeping the cabin a habitable temperature even in the most freezing of conditions.

Entirely prevents all damage or energy drain while inside an Exocraft in freezing environments.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology

title: Memory Fragment
summary: Memory Fragment is an upgrade technology.
game_description:
The shattered remnants of an expired traveller. It whispers, an unknowable name deep within its fibres.

The memory will manifest as an important technology upgrade to aid you on your travels. Absorb this memory with 20px/25px/25px (PC/PS/XB).
source_info:
*The blueprint for the Memory Fragment is obtained as a reward for completing Obsession milestone in the Expedition 7: Leviathan.
*Rewards for completing milestones in Expedition 7: Leviathan.
*Traveller at a Unknown Grave will always reward you a memory fragment.
release_history:
* Outlaws - Introduced as part of Expedition 7: Leviathan.
* Waypoint - Now rewarded from Unknown Graves.
additional_info:
*There are several types of Memory Fragments: General, Armament, Exosuit, Personal Weapon, Starship Weapon, Exocraft, and Inventory.
* Inventory Memory Fragments provide 5 inventory slots for either Exosuit, Starship, or Multi-tool.
*All other types provide either Upgrade Modules with the class reflecting the progress of searching Universal Loop, or pre-packaged random systems installers.
*Only General modules can be crafted.

title: Memory Resonator
summary: Memory Resonator is a tool for locating time loops in Expedition 7: Leviathan.
game_description: A highly familiar, entirely novel, piece of technology, designed by 20px/25px/25px (PC/PS/XB).
source_info: The blueprint for the Memory Resonator is obtained as a reward for reaching Anchor Point 1 in the Expedition 7: Leviathan.
release_history: * Outlaws - Introduced as part of Expedition 7: Leviathan.

title: Message Module
summary:
Message Module is a base building product and can be found in the Equipment/Portable Technology building category. 

It allows players to leave behind messages for other players to find similarly to the Communications Station. After building the Message Module the player will need to interact with it to set its message.

The message does not require activation to be read, instead it is displayed as white glowing text in the center of screen for anyone who approaches the Message Module.
game_description: A small and accessible information container for leaving messages or viewing left messages and short strings of information.
source_info: As of Beyond, the blueprint is available from the construction technology vendor at the Anomaly.

title: Mind Control Device
summary:
Mind Control Device is a consumable product and one of the upgrades available for frigates. It is a temporary upgrade which boosts the Trade capabilities of a frigate fleet for a single expedition by 10 points.

It is also used as an upgrade material for some Planetary Settlement buildings.
game_description:
A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition.

The mind control device plugs into the ship's trading and communications systems, allowing the Fleet Commander to gain the upper hand in any negotiation.
source_info:
* The product's blueprint is a possible reward from a Manufacturing Facility or Operations Centre.
* The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for one Salvaged Frigate Module.
* Possible drop from Sentinel starships.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a product, with frigate-related function. It has the same icon as High Capacity Vector Compressor.
* Beyond - Added an ability to research a blueprint at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Sodium Diode.
* Beacon - Used as upgrade material for new settlement building upgrade process.

title: Mineral Compressor
summary: Mineral Compressor is a consumable product and one of the upgrades available for frigates. It is a temporary upgrade which boosts the Industrial capabilities of a frigate fleet for a single expedition by 10 points.
game_description:
A temporary frigate upgrade that lasts for one expedition.

The mineral compressor allows fleet mining crews to liquidise the substances they extract, for both faster processing and easier transportation.
source_info:
* The product's blueprint is a possible reward from a Manufacturing Facility or Operations Centre.
* The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for one Salvaged Frigate Module.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a product, with frigate-related function. It has the same icon as Boiler Unit and Organic Piping, while Oxygen Filter has a different colored icon.
* Beyond - Added an ability to research a blueprint at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Cobalt Mirror.

title: Mineral Extractor
summary:
alt=|thumb|Vertical Indium farm with extractors
Mineral Extractor is a base building product that can be used to automatically harvest minerals.
game_description:
An automated mineral harvester. Determine a Deep-Level Mineral Deposit site with the Surveying upgrade for the Analysis Visor. Mineral extraction rates and produced minerals will vary from site to site.

Requires power to function. Connect to Supply Depots with Supply Pipes to allow collection from more convenient sites.
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly, costing 10 Salvaged Data to unlock.
release_history:
*Beyond - Added as a base building product.
*Origins - mineral extractors returns grow less the more are placed in one location (diminishing returns).
additional_info:
thumb|Mineral Extractor in use

*Available minerals for extraction vary from planet to planet and biome to biome.
*Every extractor can store 250 units of minerals.
*Every mineral extractor cycle produces 250 units of minerals for the extraction network.
*The building continues to produce minerals while the game is not running. Supply depots can hold this automatic harvest.

The unit is able to process the most complex recipes, but requires its own independent fuel source.

title: Mining Beam Upgrade
summary: Mining Beam Upgrades, contained within Mining Beam Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to the Multi-tool's Mining Beam.

title: Minotaur AI Pilot
summary:
Minotaur AI Pilot is a technology allowing semi-autonomous Minotaur operations.

While the game description says it can "engage in mining activities", this feature has yet to be implemented.
game_description:
A semi-autonomous artificial pilot plugin for the Minotaur Heavy Exocraft Hybrid. Installation allows the Minotaur to traverse planets itself and engage in combat or mining activities to support its primary operator.

The AI pilot will always cede control to the primary operator when they enter the cockpit.

Piloting routines are highly localised. It is incapable of developing emotional bonds nor exercising independent control of the Minotaur.
use_info:
When active, it will auto-pilot the Minotaur and it will follow the player. If the player encounters any danger such as the Sentinel or Biological Horror, the Minotaur will fight alongside the player, providing the AI is turned on and the Minotaur have at least one weapon installed. The AI can be turned off in the Quick Menu However, take note that if it took too much damage, its technology will be destroyed, which requires repair. 

Initially, the enemy will ignore the Minotaur even if it is fighting. However if the enemy was being attacked by the mech then it will strike back. If the autopilot AI was damaged, it will results in a message AI Autopilot Critically Damaged. Additionally, unless manual control were established, if the AI was damaged, it will stop fighting or following the player. If the engine were damaged, then feature is also disabled even if manual control were established, and will results in a message saying Exocraft fuel is below <20% (for unknown reasons).
release_history: *SentinelUp - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
thumb|A Player Minotaur's Technology Bar, with a Visible adjacency Bonus Border visible on both the Body and the AI Pilot.
The Minotaur AI Pilot can be disabled when on foot but not inside minotaur, by going to the cog on the left in the quickmenu. The menu item is two to the right from the flashlight item.

The Hardframe Body also adds the same AI Feature to the Minotaur. Installing both, the Body and this component, allows for the AI to continue functioning until both Components (or the Engine) are damaged, allowing the AI to remain active for longer whilst in combat.

* This may also cause more components to get damaged during battle, as the AI doesn't stop if components other than the Engine or the AI sources are damaged.
* The Body, the Liquidator Body and this Component have adjacency bonuses, but what these do exactly is unknown.

title: Minotaur Bore
summary: Minotaur Bore provides Terrain Manipulator capabilities to the Minotaur Laser. It is, however, not very fuel-efficient. You refuel it with Carbon, Condensed Carbon, or Oxygen; so bring or harvest plenty.
game_description:
Adds Terrain Manipulation capability to the laser array of the Minotaur Heavy Exosuit Hybrid.

A special mount allows the rapid deployment of a high-energy terrain excavator, without clogging the Minotaur's delicate joints and servos with dirt.

game_description:
A mounted cannon specifically designed for the Minotaur Heavy Exosuit Hybrid.

Designed primarily for damage against biological entities and inefficient when deployed as a mining device.
release_history: *ExoMech - Added as a technology.

title: Minotaur Geobay
summary:
Minotaur Geobay is used to provide a safe parking lot for the Minotaur Exocraft.

Geobays can be placed anywhere, inside or outside of a claimed base. When a geobay is destroyed, the resources used to build it are returned.

All geobays have two terminals. One terminal, with a blue screen, is used to respawn the geobay's Exocraft; the other terminal, with an orange screen, grants access to Exocraft customisation.
game_description:
A secure parking, summoning and customisation facility for the Minotaur Heavy Exosuit Hybrid.

Deploy the Minotaur from the Quick Menu. With the aid of an Orbital Exocraft Materialiser mounted inside a freighter, the Minotaur can be instantly deployed to any location within the same system as the mothership.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.63 - Geobays can now be used to customise their respective Exocraft.
* Expeditions - blueprint formula changed, Gold is now used instead of Paraffinium.

Enables conventional mining operations. Ineffective in combat scenarios.

Use the Quick Menu to tune the radar to specific buildings.

A holographic moon pool hatch. Allows easy access into and out of aquatic environments.

Pressurisation systems are automatically and discreetly hidden around the room.
source_info: The blueprint is awarded as part of Dreams of the Deep; however, it can also be unlocked early using a Blueprint Analyser.

title: Myth Beacon
summary: Myth Beacon is a curiosity acquired and used during Expedition 2: Beachhead.
game_description:
The result of Nada's research into unusual patterns detected in the stories of the Gek, Korvax, and Vy'keen.

The beacon broadcasts a signal echo attuned to the shift historiographical flux mapped by Nada's traveller companions.

Specialist Polo is unwilling to predict the results of the broadcast.
source_info: Awarded after reaching Rendezvous 5 during the Beachhead expedition. it is necessary to complete the Historiography Lesson.  After acquiring the Historiographical Dosimeter, interact with three plaques or monoliths, and select "Take dosimeter reading for Nada". Once three readings are collected and the award is unlocked, then proceed to the Space Anomaly and it will be possible to redeem 80 Quicksilver from the Quicksilver Synthesis Companion to obtain a Myth Beacon.
use_info: The Myth Beacon must be used to complete Echo Through the Ages task in the Beachhead expedition.  This is done by reaching the Boundary Failure at latitude/longitude +60.78, +119.42 on Nessie Q8 and deploying the Myth Beacon.
release_history: * Beachhead Expedition - Added as a curiosity.

title: Nada Decal
summary: Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.

This decal depicts the Korvax Priest Entity Nada.
release_history: * NEXT 1.58 - added as a base-building component.

title: Nautilon Cannon
summary:
Nautilon Cannon is an exocraft weapon for the Nautilon.

The weapon draws from an internal fuel supply to lob explosive projectiles which are affected by gravity. This fuel supply can be recharged with Carbon (0.5%/unit), Condensed Carbon (1.5%/unit) or Oxygen (1%/unit). Each shot drains 0.75% fuel when fired, and the weapon has a default fire rate of 2 shots per second, resulting in a default fuel drain rate of 1.5%/sec during continuous fire.

It has a dedicated Upgrade Module type, Nautilon Cannon Module. Upgrades from these modules may grant significant improvements to damage and rate of fire.
game_description:
A mounted cannon specifically designed for the Nautilon Submarine.

A high-energy weapon system, it superheats a small body of water before launching it rapidly towards the intended target.

Designed primarily for damage against biological entities and inefficient when deployed as a mining device.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from a Technology Merchant located on space stations for ?
additional_info: For any save editors that want to increase the actual fire rate of the cannon, duplicate copies of the Exocraft Mounted Cannon in the same exocraft increase the rate of fire indirectly due to an adjacency glitch similar to that of the Photon Cannon and Spewing Vents.
