title: Technology
summary:
Technology is an item that upgrades a player's blueprints.

When installing and upgrading technology, there are specific domains that can be upgraded. Your current stats are shown on the right hand side of the panel of your multi-tool or starship (stats for the exosuit are not displayed in-game).
* In starships, you upgrade Damage Potential, Shield Absorb, Hyperdrive Range, and Maneuverability.
* For Multi-tools, you upgrade Damage Potential and Scanner Range.
* For the Exosuit you can upgrade Life Support, Hazard Protection, Movement, and Gloves.

How to use technologies:
# Loot, buy or otherwise learn blueprints.
# Craft Technologies and install them into slots (general slots or technology slots).
# Optionally buy Upgrade Modules and install them.
# If needed, dismantle Technologies and re-craft them in a different slot.

title: Technology (Atlas)
summary:
thumb|Inventory page for a ship
There are four basic upgrade levels, labeled by Greek letters. In order of improvement they are:
* SIGMA
* TAU
* THETA
* OMEGA

Note that very few of the technologies have an OMEGA version of improvement.

When upgrading technology, there are twelve specific areas that can be upgraded. These are shown on the right hand side of three separate upgrade panels (exosuit, multi-tool, and starship).

Each icon has a number of rings surrounding it. As upgrades to that particular area of technology are made, the rings are filled in to indicate the current status level. Note that in the graphic, the Weapons icon has two circles partially filled in, corresponding to the Phase Beam and Photon Cannon. On the other hand, the Hyperdrive icon has one circle, representing a completed Hyperdrive.

title: Teleport Chamber
summary: Teleport Chamber is a Freighter Base Building module replacing Base Teleport Module.
game_description:
Vital integrated freighter equipment. This personal teleport device allows the user to move quickly between their freighter, planetary bases, as well as any Space Station Terminuses connected to their network. User is urged to verify network integrity before inserting any matter they cannot afford to become separated from.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Teleport Receiver
summary: Teleport Receiver is a starship technology, which increases ship material teleport range from 50u to 150u.
game_description:
A device that modulates standard starship communication signals to enable the transport of matter as well as data.

Starships fitted with such a device can send and receive products and substances to a user's exosuit over a long distance.
additional_info:
The Teleport Receiver is a ship upgrade that once installed allows moving items to and from your ship from a longer range.  

Default max 50u, with this upgrade max 150u. Thus tripling the distance, and the effective area coverage times 9 (Pi * radius<sup>2</sup>).  

In practice this means you can now often reach the ship from anywhere in a base or Trade Outpost etc. and not just when right next to it.

title: Temporal Warp Computer
summary: Temporal Warp Computer is a freighter technology that allows warping to blue Star systems.
game_description:
Upgrades the hyperdrive's computational matrix, preventing temporal anomalies when attempting to reach rare-class blue stellar bodies.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems via the Galactic Map.
source_info: The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for 12 Salvaged Frigate Modules.
release_history:
* Synthesis - Added as a technology that can be researched at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used TetraCobalt.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* When placed adjacent to Freighter Hyperdrive or other freighter technologies, the player will receive additional bonuses.

title: Tethys Beam
summary:
Tethys Beam is a variant of the Exocraft Mining Laser that can only be mounted on the Nautilon. 

Its internal fuel supply can be recharged with Carbon (0.5%/unit), Condensed Carbon (1.5%/unit) or Oxygen (1%/unit).

It is not a pre-installed technology and needs a blueprint to build it.
game_description:
A mounted laser system specifically designed for the Nautilon Submarine.

Fires a concentrated plasma beam towards the intended target, which is then ignited. Such a trigger mechanism allows the use of high-energy optical mining systems in a liquid medium.
source_info: The blueprint is acquired from Exocraft Technology Merchants.
additional_info: * The Tethys Beam can, under the right conditions, be used to mine Resource Deposits that are above water (they do not currently appear to spawn underwater). For this to work, the Nautilon must still be submerged or else the laser's reticle cannot be aimed higher than sea level.

title: Thermal Buffer
summary: Thermal Buffer is a hazard protection upgrade for the Exocraft.
game_description: Sublimation cooling vents and high-thermal mass buffers are installed in all structural panels, keeping the Exocraft pilot at non-lethal temperatures even in the most overwhelming of firestorms.
release_history: * ExoMech - Added as a technology

title: Thermal Panels
summary: Thermal Panels is a tradeable useful only for scrap.
game_description: A valuable piece of broken down Trade Terminal.
source_info: Sometimes created by a Starship Outfitting Terminal at a Space Station when the player chooses "Claim Scrap" menu option to salvage their starship into Units.
use_info:
Component is useful only as scrap to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
additional_info:
* 0-9 pieces are awarded when salvaging a starship.
* Maximum stack size is 25.
* Same icon is used by:
** Decommissioned Circuit Board
** Once-Useful Springs

title: Thermal Protection Module (Cold)
summary:
Thermal Protection Modules (Cold), contained within Exosuit Upgrade Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to the exosuit's Hazard Protection.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit Technology slot for it to take effect.
game_description: Increase the base capacity of the Hazard Protection system, allowing the user to spend longer in frozen sub-zero temperature environments without requiring a recharge of the traveler's  Hazard Protection Unit in the Exosuit.

title: Thermal Protection Module (Heat)
summary:
Thermal Protection Modules (Heat), contained within Exosuit Upgrade Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to the exosuit's Hazard Protection.

It needs to be installed in an inventory or Technology slot for it to take effect.
game_description: Increase the base capacity of the Hazard Protection system, allowing the user to spend longer in high temperature environments without requiring a recharge of the traveller's  Hazard Protection Unit in the Exosuit.

title: Thermal Protection Upgrade (Cold)
summary: Thermal Protection Upgrades (Cold), contained within Thermal Protection Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting supplementary protection against low temperatures.
additional_info:
*It is not clear as to what percentages of Cold Protection and Cold Shielding are given. All that has been observed is that the depletion rate is the same regardless of whether it is a little too cold or way too cold, and it is also variable amongst the pool of upgrades by an adjustable time-frame.
*Thermal Protection Upgrades (Heat)
**Toxic Protection Upgrades

These only apply in actuality to basic upgrades with a visible percentage.

title: Thermal Protection Upgrade (Heat)
summary: Thermal Protection Upgrades (Heat), contained within Thermal Protection Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting supplementary protection against high temperatures.
additional_info:
*It is not clear as to what percentages of Heat Protection and Heat Shielding are given. All that has been observed is that the depletion rate is the same regardless of whether it is a little too hot or way too hot, and it is also variable amongst the pool of upgrades by an adjustable time-frame.
*Thermal Protection Upgrades (Cold) or Toxic Protection Upgrades, though these only apply in actuality to basic upgrades with a visible percentage.

title: Thermic Layer
summary:
User is guarded from extreme cold damage on frozen worlds.

Heat capillaries threaded through a user's suit that evenly distributes liquid calidium to maintain a comfortable body temperature.

The device operates automatically once constructed within user's exosuit inventory and does not require recharging.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
release_history:
* Origins - No longer requires recharging elements such as Dioxite, Ion Battery, or Advanced Ion Battery

Category:Exosuit
Category:Thermic Layer

ja:サーマルレイヤー
Category:Blueprints
additional_info:
*Works automatically when located in a player's Exosuit inventory
*Increases cold resistance by 21%

infobox.desc: User is guarded from extreme cold damage on frozen worlds.

title: Thin Alloy Wall
summary:
Thin Alloy Wall is a Base building structure used to erect basic structures.

The basic component's preview auto-snaps to the edges of other basic components.
game_description:
Reinforced Alloy building module, widespread in basic structures across the galaxy.

Conforms to Universal Building Standards 2.3b, ensuring maximum compatibilty with other prefab structurs. Rapid Grid snapping allows for quick assembly of custom shelter layouts
release_history: * Frontiers - This item was added as a base-building component.
additional_info: *The blueprint is learned from a Construction Research Unit, or Construction Research Station.

title: Thin Concrete Wall
summary:

game_description: A thin concrete wall module for use in base construction.
release_history:

* Companions - Formula changed, formerly used Ferrite Dust
* Frontiers - Deprecated, only available in legacy saves.
additional_info: *The blueprint for Thin Concrete Wall is learned from a Blueprint Analyser.

title: Toxic Protection Module
summary:
Toxic Protection Modules, a special subcategory of Exosuit Upgrade Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting bonuses to the exosuit's Hazard Protection.

It needs to be installed in an inventory or Technology slot for it to take effect.
game_description: Increase the base capacity of the Hazard Protection system, allowing the user to spend longer in toxic environments without requiring a recharge of the traveller's  Hazard Protection Unit in the Exosuit.
release_history: * TBD

title: Toxic Protection Upgrade
summary: Toxic Protection Upgrades, contained within Toxic Protection Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting supplementary protection against toxins.
release_history: *Origins - Advanced Ion battery removed from game. Regular ion battery now recharges 100%
additional_info:
*The depletion rate is the same regardless of whether it is a little too corrosive or way too corrosive, and it is also variable amongst the pool of upgrades by an adjustable time-frame.
*Thermal Protection Upgrades (Heat)
**Thermal Protection Upgrades (Cold)
**Radiation Protection Upgrades
These only apply in actuality to basic upgrades with a visible percentage.

title: Toxin Suppressor
summary: User with a toxin suppressor installed will have some protection from toxic damage that may be inflicted by the atmospheric environment on
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene on the Space Anomaly.
release_history:
* Release - Added as a technology.
* NEXT - Removed from the game. If it was installed, it has turned into Obsolete Technology.
* Crossplay - Brought back into the game with a different description and formula
additional_info: * Works automatically when located in a player's Exosuit inventory

title: Trade Rocket
summary:
Trade Rocket is a technology that allows a player to sell Trade Goods from the planet surface.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description: A personal rocketry device with a direct link to the Galactic Trade Network. This unit allows the user to load a small spacecraft with goods. Upon launch, the goods will be transported to the nearest trade terminus and automatically sold.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Selene in the Space Anomaly for 90
release_history: * Waypoint - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
* Trade Rocket has 25 slots.
* It requires tritium to operate.
* Be careful however, the Rocket does not trade for nanites, so pay attention, otherwise you will waste nanite related items like sentinel upgrades.
* Units are credited instantly after pressing the launch button.
* It can be followed after launch, and flies at normal (non-boost, non-Pulse Drive) speeds in the direction of the Space Station. It is invulnerable to damage, but can damage your ship's shields if it flies into you.

title: United Federation of Travelers Decal
summary: Decals are decoration items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.
game_description:
An exclusive placeable decal, to add flair and decoration to bases.

This decal represents the United Federation of Travelers. Document, aid, create, communicate.
release_history: * NEXT 1.58 - added as a base-building component.

title: Unstable Gel
summary: Unstable Gel is a tradeable that is used in crafting.
game_description:
A highly reactive gel, this substance is both energy-rich and dangerous to touch.

Crafted from Cactus Flesh.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a component.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.
additional_info: The Unstable Gel blueprint is awarded when you construct the Science Terminal and continue the Scientist quest line.

title: Unstable Plasma
summary: Unstable Plasma is a consumable product.
game_description: Densely-packed fuel capsule for use in the land disruption grenade technology.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Release - Added as a product.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Thamium9 and Plutonium. Now it can be refined.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Utopia Research Station
summary: Utopia Research Station is a portable base building product for discovering new blueprints/technology, it can be acquired by completing some patch of the Expedition 9: Utopia.
source_info:
It can be found in the Build Menu under Tech/Portable. Once deployed, it provides access to the following construction research trees (there are 4 types of station):

*Exosuit technology
*Multi-Tool technology
*Starship technology
*Base Construction blueprint

These trees can change depending on the station type. Like Construction Research Station or Construction Research Unit, low-lvl blueprint must be known before you can use high-lvl blueprint.

title: Vertical Glass Tunnel
summary:
Vertical Glass Tunnel is a base building product which has no comparable corridor. A ladder can be constructed within it for ease of ascent.

This structure's preview auto-snaps to many vertical anchors.
game_description:
Pressurised, reinforced glass tunnels for deep-sea construction.

Advanced nano-mineral coating ensures high performance at depth, without compromising visibility.
source_info: The blueprint is awarded as part of Dreams of the Deep; however, it can also be unlocked early using a Blueprint Analyser.
release_history: * Abyss - Added as a base building product.

title: Viewing Sphere
summary:
Viewing Spheres are Base building structures designed to allow one to view the surrounding environment without also being subjected to its hazards.

During placement, the previews of these large structures auto-snap only to horizontal anchors.
game_description: A self-contained spherical viewing platform which affords the user stunning views of the surrounding environment.
release_history: * Pathfinder - this item was added as a base-building component
additional_info:
* This blueprint can be acquired from the Blueprint Analyser
* Power consumption is 1kP

title: Voltaic Amplifier
summary: The Voltaic Amplifier is a general Multi-tool upgrade for all multi-tool weapons.
game_description:
A generalised upgrade for all Multi-Tool weapon systems, causing its projectiles to resonate dramatically upon impact with any appropriate electromagnetic field.

Will significantly increase the damage dealt to any organic and inorganic entities that are currently stunned.

Stats: Damage stunned entities +21%
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired in the Space Anomaly for 180
release_history: *SentinelUp - added as a technology

title: Vy'keen Decal
summary:
thumb|Decal in use
Decals are items used in base building. There are a variety of patterns, all with the same blueprint formula.

This decal is a stylized Vy'keen logo.
game_description: Placeable decorative decals.
release_history:
* Pathfinder - added as a base-building component.
* Frontiers - renamed, formerly "Decal".

title: Walker Brain
summary: Walker Brain is a component that is used for crafting.
game_description:
Shifting nanite clusters sewn together with a pugneum filament, this circuit is painfully hot to the touch.

A sinister purple light leaks from deep within its wiring, changing in intensity as it watches its holder.
source_info:
* Loot from a Envoy
* Suspicious Packet (Goods)
* Mission Board missions
* Nexus missions
* Can be found on a robot at the Harmonic Scrap point of interest
release_history:
* NEXT 1.58 - Icon changed.
* Origins - Can now be found in Scrap Dealer crates.
* Origins 3.05 - Tainted Metal is now used for purchasing instead of pugneum.
additional_info: * Sources extraced from the 3.75 version of the REWARDTABLE.MBIN game file.

title: Wall Screen
summary: Wall Screen is an item used in base building.
release_history: * Pathfinder - added as a base-building component. It has the same icon as Output Screen.

title: Wall Switch
summary: Wall Switch is a base building product that is used to toggle power to buildings using Electrical Wiring.
game_description:
A power management device, the switch will toggle the flow of power when pulled.

Switches require both power and signal wires to control a device.
additional_info:
* The blueprint can be acquired from the Construction Research Station on the Space Anomaly for 1 Salvaged Data.
* The product activated in the same way as a Button by a player using it (default E key). The difference is that this one needs to be used by a player one more time to be deactivated, while a Button will deactivate automatically after 1 second of being active.

title: Warp Cell
summary:
Warp Cell is a consumable product used to fuel the starship's hyperdrive.

It charges the hyperdrive for one jump, but 4 cells will charge the hyperdrive for 5 jumps.
game_description:
This antimatter-based fuel is one of the few power sources capable of meeting the incredible energy requirements of a starship hyperdrive.

Secured within a robust housing, the cell is guaranteed paradox-free during FTL travel.
release_history:
* Release - Original game component.
* NEXT - Formula changed, formerly used Thamium9 and Antimatter. Icon changed.
* Waypoint - Charging changed, now only 4 Warp Cells required to fully charge the hyperdrive, previously was 5.
additional_info: * You cannot sell Warp Cells.

title: Warp Core Resonator
summary: Warp Core Resonator is a level 1 freighter technology and it improves the Freighter Hyperdrive capabilities by increasing the distance that can be traveled by a freighter.
game_description:
An augmentation for the colossal hyperdrive engine of an interstellar freighter.

Quantum resonation
source_info: The blueprint can be researched at the Upgrade Control terminal for four Salvaged Frigate Modules.
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a technology that can be researched at the Freighter Research Terminal.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Oxygen Filter.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* When placed adjacent to Freighter Hyperdrive or other freighter technologies, the player will receive additional bonuses.

title: Watertight Door
summary:
Watertight Door is a base building product which is the underwater-exclusive equivalent of Holo-Door.

This structure's preview auto-snaps to many horizontal anchors.
game_description: A compression-sealed, standard door suitable for all rooms and corridors.
source_info: The blueprint is awarded as part of Dreams of the Deep; however, it can also be unlocked early using a Blueprint Analyser.
release_history: * Abyss - Added as a base building product.

title: Waveform Oscillator
summary:
Waveform Oscillator is a Multi-tool upgrade which applies a brief stunning effect to any target hit by the Javelin's beam. The stun is of the same duration regardless of the Javelin's charge level. The blueprint can be purchased in Space Anomaly.

Waveform Oscillator needs to be crafted and then stored in a Multi-tool inventory slot for it to have its effect. Unlike Blaze Javelin Upgrades, this technology does not count toward the three-upgrade limit, making it useful for enhancing Upgrade bonuses on other upgrades.
game_description:
Overloads the energy beam generated by the Blaze Javelin, causing it to deliver a power electrical charge at its poin of impact.

Will briefly stun any organic and inorganic entities that intersect the Blaze Javelin's beam.
release_history: * SentinelUp - added as a technology upgrade

title: Waveform Recycler
summary:
Waveform Recycler is a technology that increases the scan radius and decreases the recharge time of the Scanner. 

It needs to be installed in a Multi-tool inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description:
A powerful lateral processor inserted into the Multi-Tool Scanning System allows the device to recharge at a significantly improved rate.

Increase potential scan frequency.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from a Technology Merchant for 120

title: Weapons Terminal
summary:
The Weapons Terminal is used for weaponry and explosives. It is used by a hired NPC known as an Armourer. These NPCs can be recruited in space stations within Vy'keen controlled systems.

The blueprints for the following items can be acquired at a Weapons Terminal based on specific quests from the Armourer.

* Haz-Mat Gauntlet
* Cyclotron Ballista
* Advanced Mining Laser
* Positron Ejector
* Infra-Knife Accelerator
game_description:
thumb|right|Weapons terminal
A research station tailored to the needs of Armourers, and equipped for the development of munitions and explosives as well as selected civilian tech.
release_history:
*Foundation - added as a type of terminal
*Beyond - formula changed, had been 50 Iron
*Crossplay - formula changed, had been 25 Magnetised Ferrite
additional_info:
* It can be built in a Cylindrical Room or a Square Room.
* The multitool can be up to S class
* You can re-roll which multitool you get by changing systems. Can be done quickly with a freighter that has the Weapons Terminal built on it. By changing systems, you can improve the class by one level, as some systems will give you a slightly better multitool than others.

title: Weapons Terminal Room
summary: Weapons Terminal Room is a Freighter Base Building module accomodating Armourer terminal.
game_description:
Integrated freighter research equipment tailored to the needs of armourer, and equipped for the development of munitions and explosives as well as selected civilian tech.

This module is placed as an entire room and comes with its functional units pre-installed.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology

title: Welding Soap
summary: Welding Soap is a 2nd tier tradeable.
game_description:
Several large bars of welding soap.

Used in power generation systems to heat-clean metal diodes before they're fused into batteries.
source_info: Welding Soap can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Technology Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, low-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Welding Soap can be sold for a profit in any Power Generation Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.

Welding Soap can be used as certain (Synthesis Plant C->B) Settlement buildings upgrades.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Technology Parts".
additional_info:
The same icon is used by:
*Handful of Cogs
*Subatomic Regulators
*Tank of Coolant

title: Wormhole Brain
summary:
Wormhole Brain is a Living Ship technology and allows the player to check a star system's economy and conflict status in the Galactic Map without having to warp to that system.

Essentially, the Wormhole Brain serves as the equivalent of a regular Starship's Conflict Scanner and Economy Scanner, fused into one item and adjusted for Living Ships.
game_description:
The wormhole brain permits the ship vision of systems far beyond its own experience. It consists of strands of neural matter, wrapped around a micro-singularity and tethered directly to the ship's visual cortex.

Detailed economic and conflict data will become available on the Galaxy Map, should the ship permit it.
source_info: Grown from a Wormhole Brain Implant.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology.
additional_info: The Wormhole Brain shares an icon with the Growing Singularity.

infobox.desc: Grants the remote ability to check a system's economy and conflict

title: Wormhole Brain Implant
summary: Wormhole Brain Implant is a Living Ship technology and can evolve into Wormhole Brain which allows the player to check a star system's economy and conflict status in the Galactic Map without having to warp to that system.
game_description: A pre-grown bionic implant, designed to facilitate the fusion of bio-technology to sentient starships. Use
source_info: Wormhole Brain Implant is grown from Psychonic Egg.
release_history: * Endurance - Added as a technology.

Pressurised, reinforced glass tunnels for deep-sea construction.

Advanced nano-mineral coating ensures high performance at depth, without compromising visibility.
source_info: The blueprint is awarded as part of Dreams of the Deep; however, it can also be unlocked early using a Blueprint Analyser.
